4. You’ll need to link accounts with each loyalty program before initiating a transfer. In this case, we’ll select Avianca LifeMiles. Add your partner account number and select Continue.

Image Credit: Wells Fargo

5. Enter the number of points you want to transfer, hit Accept the terms and conditions, and click Submit. Transfers are final, so make sure you’ve confirmed your award availability before this point!

Image Credit: Wells Fargo

Advertisement

Final Thoughts

The only way to exceed a redemption value of more than 1 cent per point with Wells Fargo Rewards is to book travel via transfer partners. While these programs may not be familiar to you, alliances offer dozens of ways to get maximum value from your hard-earned points.

With the right amount of Wells Fargo Rewards points, you can vacation just about anywhere. We hope this guide provided you with some travel inspiration and helpful redemption tips.

1.title: Wells Fargo expands its commercial banking transformation with Q2
1.snippet: Wells Fargo has launched a commercial banking platform designed to improve bankers' ability to serve commercial clients and increase.
1.content:
Wells Fargo expands its commercial banking transformation with Q2

By Gloria Methri

February 10, 2025 Americas

Andi

banking software Share

Wells Fargo has partnered with Q2 Holdings to launch a new commercial banking platform, supporting its digital transformation efforts and enhancing bankers’ efficiency.

“Wells Fargo is committed to delivering superior value to our commercial banking clients,” said Mary Katherine Dubose, EVP and Head of Commercial Banking Specialized Industries at Wells Fargo. “We are excited to partner with Q2 on this important initiative and to have completed the initial phases of Q2’s implementation. This new solution enables our teams to serve our customers with the agility and insights required in an increasingly dynamic market.”

Q2 serves banks, credit unions, alternative finance companies, and FinTechs in the U.S. and internationally. It enables financial institutions and FinTech customers to provide comprehensive, data-driven digital engagement solutions for consumers, small businesses and corporate clients. Q2’s solution is trusted by more than 30,000 bankers across 140 leading financial institutions, including more than half of the 15 largest banks in North America.

“We are excited to partner with Wells Fargo to transform and enhance the experience they provide to their commercial clients,” said Q2 President Kirk Coleman. “Q2 empowers client relationship teams with actionable, real-time insights and coaching to deliver exceptional service across products.”

As an expert in commercial relationship solutions, Q2 helps financial institutions of all sizes analyse millions of relationships annually. Its virtual insights analyst, Andi®, augments bankers’ strengths with the latest technology, data and insights.

Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Q2 has offices worldwide and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the stock symbol QTWO.

2.title: Foreclosure ruling paves way for sale of Downtown Cincinnati tower
2.snippet: One of downtown Cincinnati's largest office towers will likely soon be up for sale.
2.content:
CINCINNATI ( ) - The lender in a foreclosure case surrounding one of downtown Cincinnati’s largest office towers has asked to begin the sale process after a judge issued a final ruling against the building’s owner last month.

Hamilton County Common Pleas Judge Lisa Allen Jan. 7 granted a motion for default judgement against the owner of the 30-story Center at 600 Vine.

The lender, Wells Fargo Bank National Association, acting as trustee for the holders of two outstanding mortgage notes, filed suit in November 2023.

from the Cincinnati Business Courier.

Cincinnati Business Courier is a Local 12 News partner

3.title: Hewitt named to Wells Fargo All-Tournament Team
3.snippet: MINNEAPOLIS – May 28, 2008 – Wells Fargo, the premier corporate sponsor of the Minnesota State High School League (MSHSL), has announced that Jack Hewitt of...
3.content:
To place an obituary, please include the information from the obituary checklist below in an email to obits@pioneerpress.com. There is no option to place them through our website. Feel free to contact our obituary desk at 651-228-5263 with any questions.

General Information:

Your full name,

Address (City, State, Zip Code),

Phone number,

And an alternate phone number (if any)

Obituary Specification:

Name of Deceased,

Obituary Text,

A photo in a JPEG or PDF file is preferable, TIF and other files are accepted, we will contact you if there are any issues with the photo.

Ad Run dates

There is a discount for running more than one day, but this must be scheduled on the first run date to apply.

If a photo is used, it must be used for both days for the discount to apply, contact us for more information.

Policies:

Verification of Death:

In order to publish obituaries a name and phone number of funeral home/cremation society is required. We must contact the funeral home/cremation society handling the arrangements during their business hours to verify the death. If the body of the deceased has been donated to the University of Minnesota Anatomy Bequest Program, or a similar program, their phone number is required for verification.

Please allow enough time to contact them especially during their limited weekend hours.

A death certificate is also acceptable for this purpose but only one of these two options are necessary.

Guestbook and Outside Websites:

We are not allowed to reference other media sources with a guestbook or an obituary placed elsewhere when placing an obituary in print and online. We may place a website for a funeral home or a family email for contact instead; contact us with any questions regarding this matter.

Obituary Process:

Once your submission is completed, we will fax or email a proof for review prior to publication in the newspaper. This proof includes price and days the notice is scheduled to appear.

Please review the proof carefully. We must be notified of errors or changes before the notice appears in the Pioneer Press based on each day’s deadlines.

After publication, we will not be responsible for errors that may occur after final proofing.

Online:

Changes to an online obituary can be handled through the obituary desk. Call us with further questions.

Payment Procedure:

Pre-payment is required for all obituary notices prior to publication by the deadline specified below in our deadline schedule. Please call 651-228-5263 with your payment information after you have received the proof and approved its contents.

Credit Card: Payment accepted by phone only due to PCI (Payment Card Industry) regulations

EFT: Check by phone. Please provide your routing number and account number.

Cash: Accepted at our FRONT COUNTER Monday – Friday from 8:00AM – 3:30PM

Rates:

The minimum charge is $162 for the first 10 lines.

Every line after the first 10 is $12.20.

If the ad is under 10 lines it will be charged the minimum rate of $162.

On a second run date, the lines are $8.20 per line, starting w/ the first line.

For example: if first run date was 20 lines the cost would be $164.

Each photo published is $125 per day.

For example: 2 photos in the paper on 2 days would be 4 photo charges at $500.

Deadlines:

Please follow deadline times to ensure your obituary is published on the day requested.

Hours Deadline (no exceptions) Ad Photos MONDAY – FRIDAY 9:00AM – 5:00 PM Next Day Publication Must receive obituary content and payment same day by 4:30PM Make changes by 5:00PM Must receive photo(s) by 4:30PM SATURDAYS 10:00AM – 2:00PM Sunday Publication Must receive obituary content and payment same day by 1:30PM Make changes by 2:00PM Must receive photo(s) by 1:30PM SUNDAYS 12:00PM – 3:00PM Monday Publication Must receive obituary content, payment, and final changes same day by 2:30PM Must receive photo(s) by 2:30PM

MEMORIAM (NON-OBITUARY) REQUEST

Unlike an obituary, Memoriam submissions are remembrances of a loved one who has passed. The rates for a memoriam differ from obituaries.

Please call or email us for more memoriam information

Please call 651-228-5280 for more information.

HOURS: Monday – Friday 8:00AM – 5:00PM (CLOSED WEEKENDS and HOLIDAYS)

Please submit your memoriam ad to memoriams@pioneerpress.com or call 651-228-5280.

4.title: Adero Partners LLC Increases Holdings in Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC)
4.snippet: Adero Partners LLC boosted its position in Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC) by 16.1% during the 4th quarter, according to the company in its most recent...
4.content:
Wells Fargo & Company is a multinational financial services company that has established itself as a prominent player in the global financial industry. Founded in 1852 and headquartered in San Francisco, California, Wells Fargo operates in 35 countries and serves over 70 million customers worldwide. Its rich history and successful mergers and acquisitions have contributed to its significant global presence.

As a comprehensive financial services provider, Wells Fargo offers a wide range of banking, investment, mortgage, and consumer financial services. The company's mission is to satisfy its customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. Wells Fargo aims to achieve this by providing exceptional service, acting with integrity, fostering diversity and inclusion, and contributing positively to the communities it serves.

Wells Fargo's extensive product and service portfolio caters to various market segments. The company serves individual consumers, small businesses, corporations, and institutional investors. Its key customers encompass a broad spectrum, ranging from everyday banking customers to high-net-worth individuals and large corporations. Wells Fargo aims to meet the diverse financial needs of its customers through personalized solutions and innovative offerings.

The company has achieved several notable milestones and received recognition for its contributions to the financial industry. Wells Fargo has been ranked as one of the "Big Four Banks" in the United States, alongside JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, and Citigroup. It is also recognized as one of the largest banks in the country by total assets, deposits, and market capitalization. Wells Fargo's commitment to delivering quality financial services has earned it a position among the most valuable bank brands.

Wells Fargo is led by an experienced and capable management team that guides the company's operations and strategic direction. The leadership team consists of individuals with diverse backgrounds and extensive finance, banking, technology, risk management, and customer service expertise. The Chief Executive Officer and President of Wells Fargo is Charles W. Scharf, who brings a wealth of experience in the financial industry. The management team also includes key executives such as Michael J. Santomassimo as the Chief Financial Officer and Scott Powell as the Chief Operating Officer. Each management team member contributes their professional background, accomplishments, and expertise to ensure the company's success.

Wells Fargo has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the years, driven by its diverse business segments and strategic initiatives. The company has reported steady revenue growth, reflecting its ability to attract and retain a large customer base. Wells Fargo's revenue metrics indicate its success in generating income through its various financial services and product offerings.

Earnings metrics illustrate the company's profitability and stability. Wells Fargo's focus on prudent risk management practices and diversified revenue streams contributes to its ability to generate sustainable earnings. Profit margin metrics showcase the efficiency of Wells Fargo's operations. The company's ability to manage costs effectively while generating revenue is key to maintaining healthy profit margins. Debt levels play a significant role in evaluating the company's financial position. Wells Fargo's management strives to maintain a conservative approach to managing debt, ensuring a strong balance sheet and financial stability.

Wells Fargo's valuation metrics are influenced by a range of factors, including its market position, financial performance, growth prospects, risk profile, and investor sentiment. Factors driving Wells Fargo's valuation include its brand recognition, customer base, diversified business segments, and ability to generate consistent earnings. Changes in investor sentiment, market conditions, and regulatory developments can also impact the company's valuation over time.

Investors closely monitor Wells Fargo's stock performance, assessing its ability to deliver value over the long term. The stock has had issues in the past due to news or events that have affected the company's share price, such as regulatory actions, the global pandemic, and strategic initiatives. These factors should be considered in analyzing its market performance.

Wells Fargo operates in the highly competitive financial services industry, which is subject to evolving regulatory frameworks and technological advancements. Understanding the broader industry in which the company operates is crucial to assessing its competitive positioning.

Wells Fargo competes with other major banks and financial institutions domestically and internationally. The company leverages its brand recognition, extensive product and service offerings, customer relationships, and technological capabilities to gain a competitive advantage. However, it also faces challenges such as regulatory compliance, changing customer preferences, and disruptive market forces.

Wells Fargo has identified several growth opportunities within its diverse business segments. The company aims to deepen relationships with existing customers, attract new customers and expand its presence in key markets. In consumer banking, Wells Fargo focuses on enhancing digital capabilities, improving customer experience, and providing innovative solutions to meet evolving customer needs. The company seeks to leverage its strong brand and customer base to drive growth and increase customer loyalty. In wealth and investment management, Wells Fargo aims to capitalize on the growing demand for comprehensive financial planning and advisory services. The company's expertise in wealth management positions it well to capture opportunities in an increasingly complex investment landscape.

As with any financial institution, Wells Fargo faces various risks and challenges. It is important to comprehensively analyze potential risks and challenges to understand their potential impact on the company's performance. Factors such as regulatory changes, cybersecurity threats, economic downturns, and reputational risks pose challenges to Wells Fargo's operations. The company has implemented robust risk management strategies, invested in technology and security measures, and enhanced compliance frameworks to mitigate these risks. Ongoing efforts to prioritize ethical conduct, transparency, and stakeholder trust are integral to managing risks effectively.

5.title: Single dad, 55, loses $50,000 just weeks before buying home – scammers racked up $25,000 and left him with...
5.snippet: A SINGLE dad says fraudsters stole his $50000 savings from his bank account - and racked up $25000 on his business line of credit.John Mattarella, 5.
5.content:
A SINGLE dad says fraudsters stole his $50,000 savings from his bank account - and racked up $25,000 on his business line of credit.

John Mattarella, 55, was weeks away from putting an offer in on his first home when he got a text alert, which he believes was from his bank, Wells Fargo.

1 Single father, John Mattarella, was cleared out of thousands Credit: SWNS:South West News Service

The bank asked for his banking security code - which he sent.

Days later, his business account was cleared out of $50,000, and his credit card had a $25,000 balance on it - leaving him with a monthly $900 bill.

Now he says he's received a letter from his bank saying the case was closed and he is responsible for the missing money and not the bank.

Mattarella has since instructed a lawyer to help with his case and is currently going through mediation with the bank.

"All my savings are gone," said Mattarella, a small business owner from Parkland, Florida.

"I was two weeks away from putting an offer in on my very first house, and then I had to back out of it.

"I can't afford to pay this loan. I can't afford to pay for my daughter's college fees or medical bills - I just can't."

WHAT HAPPENED?

Mattarella was sitting at home when he got a text which he believes was from his bank, asking if he had authorized a $1,500 payment from his account on July 23, 2024.

He replied "no" and was asked to enter his security code.

A few days later, Mattarella got a call from Wells Fargo asking if he had authorized three $25,000 wire transactions from his personal account and business account.

"I told them I hadn't, but it was too late, and my money was gone," said Mattarella.

Mattarella was informed that he would get his money back within 10 days, and left the matter alone.

However, 10 days later, John received a letter from Wells Fargo stating that they were not liable for the missing money.

In the letter, the bank stated that "under our online access agreement and deposit account agreement, you are responsible for online wires that comply with governing security procedure, even if you did not initiate them."

"I broke down and cried. I had a nervous breakdown," said Mattarella.

"Instead of $50,000 in savings and a small business loan, I have a $25,000 business loan and no money."

Mattarella said if he knew he was liable for money he did not authorize going out of his account, he would have moved banks.

He has also instructed a lawyer to help his case and is currently going into mediation with the bank.

"Most of us consumers have no idea that if your money is hacked, it is highly unlikely you will ever see it again," Mattarella said.

Mattarella added that if he is unable to get his money back, he will have to file for bankruptcy.

Wells Fargo did not respond to a request for comment.

WELLS FARGO IN THE NEWS

Wells Fargo CEO Charles Scharf announced major changes to the bank's app to go along with an influx of 1.5 million mobile customers and its renovation of 730 branches in 2024.

"The company has been working to refurbish branches acros the country, with 730 banks being completed by the end of last year," Scharf said in a meeting.

"We continue to make enhancements to our mobile app, including making it significantly easier to open accounts, and in the fourth quarter, over 40% of consumer check accounts were up additionally."

Sales transactions from customers using Zelle through Wells Fargo increased 22 percent last year, accounting for over $1 billion in sales transactions.

However, a Wells Fargo customer had her account emptied after using Zelle.

Charlotte Stenz, username Charlottestenz8 on TikTok, warned followers about the scam in a tearful video posted to the social media platform.

"I got a call from a Wells Fargo number, saying that I have fraudulent activity on my account and that a random person was being sent money from Zelle," said Stenz.

"They told me to go into my account and that I needed to secure my Zelle on my end by sending money that would go back into my account right after."

In other banking news, Capitol One was caught ‘cheating customers out of $2b’ as it’s sued by feds for ‘baiting people’ trying to build savings.

Plus, a customer also claimed last year they know what "really" caused their account with the financial institution to be closed while paying off a credit card.

6.title: How Much Are Wells Fargo Rewards Points Worth? [26 FAQs]
6.snippet: This guide explains the value you can achieve from your Wells Fargo Rewards points and the redemptions that are available to you.
6.content:
If you’re interested in redeeming credit card points for travel, Wells Fargo Rewards is certainly worth a closer look. While Wells Fargo has long offered benefits such as 0% APR or simple cash rewards, the issuer has recently leveled up by introducing a roster of airline and hotel partners for added flexibility.

With a couple of personal and business credit cards on the market, it’s easier than ever to rack up points on daily spending with Wells Fargo. This guide explains the value you can achieve from your Wells Fargo Rewards points and the redemptions that are available to you.

1. What Are Wells Fargo Rewards Points?

Wells Fargo Rewards points are the currency you earn and redeem on eligible Wells Fargo credit cards.

The Wells Fargo Rewards program is just one of many credit card programs available to consumers. Competing options include American Express Membership Rewards, Bilt Rewards, Capital One Miles, Chase Ultimate Rewards, and Citi ThankYou Rewards.

There are 2 cards that earn Wells Fargo Rewards points:

Wells Fargo Autograph Journey℠ Card U.P. Rating The rating for this card has been determined by our own industry experts who know the ins and outs of credit card products. Bonuses, rewards as well as rates and fees are all taken into account. Compensation from the issuer does not affect our rating. We only recommend products we either use ourselves or endorse. A powerful point earning card with access to transfer partners. Wells Fargo Autograph Journey℠ Card A powerful point earning card with access to transfer partners. Welcome Offer Earn 60,000 bonus points when you spend $4,000 in purchases in the first 3 months – that’s $600 toward your next trip. 60,000 points UP's Offer Valuation*: $900 Annual Fee $95 APR 20.24%, 25.24%, or 29.24% Variable APR Credit Recommended Upgraded Points credit ranges are a variation of FICO®Score 8, one of many types of credit scores lenders may use when considering your credit cardapplication. Good to Excellent (670-850) Why We Like This Card The Wells Fargo Autograph JourneySM Card is an excellent option for those looking for a great all-around travel rewards card that offers bonus categories on hotels, airfare, travel, and dining, giving you the opportunity to earn points on these purchases quickly. Plus the card offers flexible redemption options including access to transfer partners, an annual statement credit with airfare purchase, and no foreign transaction fees. Pros & Cons Pros Earn 5x points on hotels

Earn 4x points on airfare

Earn 3x points on other travel and restaurants; 1x on other purchases Cons $95 annual fee

List of transfer partners is smaller than competing programs Read Full Review Card Highlights Select “Learn More” to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

Earn 60,000 bonus points when you spend $4,000 in purchases in the first 3 months – that’s $600 toward your next trip.

Earn unlimited 5X points on hotels, 4X points on airlines, 3X points on other travel and restaurants, and 1X points on other purchases.

$95 Annual Fee.

Book your travel with the Autograph Journey Card and enjoy Travel Accident Insurance, Lost Baggage Reimbursement, Trip Cancellation and Interruption Protection and Auto Rental Collision Damage Waiver.

Earn a $50 annual statement credit with $50 minimum airline purchase.

Up to $1,000 of cell phone protection against damage or theft. Subject to a $25 deductible.

Find tickets to top sports and entertainment events, book travel, make dinner reservations and more with your complimentary 24/7 Visa Signature® Concierge. Financial Snapshot APR: 20.24%, 25.24%, or 29.24% Variable APR

Foreign Transaction Fees: None

That said, a few other Wells Fargo cards technically earn cash rewards instead. These include the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card, Wells Fargo Attune℠ Card, and Signify Business Cash℠ Card by Wells Fargo.

It’s possible to convert your cash rewards into Wells Fargo Rewards points if you have either Autograph card. We’ll go over this concept later in this guide, but you’ll want to pay extra attention if you’re interested in redeeming points with Wells Fargo’s transfer partners.

Hot Tip: The Wells Fargo Reflect® Card does not earn cash rewards or Wells Fargo Rewards points. However, it has a $0 annual fee and offers 0% intro APR for 21 months from account opening on purchases and qualifying balance transfers, then a variable APR of 17.24%, 23.74%, or 28.99%.

2. Are the Rewards Points Worth It?

If you’re able to pay your credit card statements on time and in full, there’s no reason why you shouldn’t earn rewards in the process.

If Wells Fargo is your bank of choice, earning Wells Fargo Rewards points is definitely worth it. While not as popular as Amex, Chase, or Capital One, Wells Fargo has improved its rewards program vastly over recent months with a handful of airline and hotel partners.

Holding a transferrable currency like Wells Fargo Rewards points can be quite handy when you want to redeem points for maximum value. The ability to earn Wells Fargo Rewards points on airfare, hotels, gas, restaurants, and everyday purchases makes it easy to collect points for your next vacation.

Advertisement

3. How Do I Check My Rewards Points on my Card?

Checking your balance of Wells Fargo Rewards points can be done in 3 ways:

Log in to your online account through Wells Fargo’s website

Access your Wells Fargo mobile app

Call the number on the back of your Wells Fargo credit card

To access your Wells Fargo Rewards points on the bank’s website, you’ll first need to log in using your user ID and password. From there, you can see your account dashboard with all of the accounts and debit or credit cards you have open with the issuer. You can click your balance of Wells Fargo Rewards, then click My Rewards and Rewards Activity/Orders to see a detailed breakdown of your points history.

If you want to check your Wells Fargo Rewards points through the Wells Fargo mobile app, log in to your Wells Fargo mobile app using your user ID and password. The app will show the Wells Fargo Rewards button up top with a right arrow. Then, click My Rewards and Rewards Activity/Orders for recent point earning and redeeming activity.

To access your Wells Fargo Rewards points over the phone, call the number on the back of your card. Then, follow the prompts for Wells Fargo Rewards points. You can hear your Wells Fargo Rewards points balance via an automated prompt and can speak to a customer service representative for further assistance.

4. How Much Are Wells Fargo Rewards Points Worth?

Every month, we publish our updated list of points and miles valuations across dozens of programs. At this time, we value Wells Fargo Rewards points at approximately 1.5 cents each.

Keep in mind that this valuation is subjective, and how much value you get from points depends on how you use them. For instance, redeeming points for gift cards or cash rewards will only get you a set value of 1 cent each. Leveraging transfer partners can get you much more value, but knowing our benchmark can help you gauge whether you achieved good value from your rewards.

Getting 3 to 6 cents per point is possible with Wells Fargo Rewards. To play on the safe side, we’ll assume that you can redeem your points for roughly 1.5 cents each when leveraging transfer partners.

5. How Much Are Wells Fargo Autograph Journey Card Points Worth?

The Wells Fargo Autograph Journey card earns Wells Fargo Rewards points, which are worth 1.5 cents in our view. However, the value can greatly depend on how you redeem them — and there’s no shortage of options to choose from.

If you redeem your Wells Fargo Rewards points for a statement credit, cash rewards, gift cards, online merchandise, Apple purchases, or PayPal rewards, you’ll get back 1 cent per point. For example, using 1,000 points for any of these options would yield $10 in redemption value.

You can also book travel through the Wells Fargo Rewards portal, including flights, hotels, vacation packages, cruises, and attractions. However, the value is fixed and will get you 1 cent per point.

In our opinion, the absolute best way to redeem Wells Fargo Rewards points is booking award travel with transfer partners. While there’s no set value here, it’s possible to get anywhere from 1 to 10 cents per point of value.

Advertisement

6. How Much Are 2,500 Wells Fargo Rewards Points Worth?

According to our valuations, 2,500 Wells Fargo Rewards points are worth $37.50.

While 2,500 points aren’t enough for a business class flight, you could redeem 2,500 points for:

$25 in cash rewards at a Wells Fargo ATM (if you also have a Wells Fargo debit card)

$25 in gift cards at retailers such as Sephora, Lowe’s, and more

$25 in online merchandise at participating stores, including Best Buy or Bass Pro Shops

$25 in travel via the Wells Fargo Rewards portal

The last option is particularly interesting. Let’s say you’re interested in booking a hotel night for $150 via the Wells Fargo Rewards portal. While 2,500 Wells Fargo Rewards points aren’t enough for a free stay, you could shave off $25 of the final cost at checkout.

Bottom Line: We recommend saving up your points to have a larger balance to redeem for flights or hotels with Wells Fargo’s transfer partners.

7. What is the Value of 10K Wells Fargo Rewards Points?

We value 10,000 Wells Fargo Rewards Points at $150.

Once you’ve earned a sum of 10,000 points, you could easily have enough to book a one-way economy ticket. For example, you can transfer 9,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points to receive 9,000 British Airways Executive Club Avios.

If you’re not familiar with the frequent flyer program, it has a distance-based award chart for redemptions. With those 9,000 points, you can redeem for one-way flights on American Airlines and Alaska Airlines that are 651 to 1,151 miles in flight distance. Going a step further, you can redeem 11,000 miles for flight distances of 1,152 to 2,000 miles.

You can book domestic flights with points. Image Credit: Katie Seemann

There are countless examples of short domestic flights that fall under this flight distance band. For example, transferring 9,000 points to British Airways Avios can get you from New York (LGA) to Chicago (ORD) or Miami (MIA) to Dallas (DFW).

These flights could retail upwards of $250 in many cases, so redeeming British Airways Avios can get you over 2.7 cents in value. And, you’ll have 1,000 remaining Wells Fargo Rewards points for your next redemptions.

Of course, there are other lower-value redemptions with 10,000 points. You can redeem those for $100 in cash rewards, $100 in gift cards, or $100 in travel booked through Wells Fargo Rewards.

8. How Much Are 15K Points Worth?

We value 15,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points at about $225.

Once you’ve earned 15,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points, you’ll have more options to redeem rewards for great value. You can redeem British Airways Avios for transcontinental flights in economy, such as New York (JFK) to Los Angeles (LAX) on American or Alaska.

Another great transfer partner to consider using is Avianca LifeMiles. The transfer ratio is 1:1, so 1 Wells Fargo Rewards point is equal to 1 Avianca LifeMile. As a member of the Star Alliance, you’ll have the opportunity to book United Airlines flights for a solid price. For instance, a round-trip ticket from San Francisco (SFO) to Phoenix (PHX) will cost just 15,000 miles.

Looking for hotel nights instead? Choice Privileges is the only hotel transfer partner at the time of writing, but Wells Fargo offers an extraordinary 1:2 transfer ratio. For every 1 Wells Fargo point you transfer, you’ll receive 2 Choice Privileges points.

Book hotel nights through the Choice Privileges program. Image Credit: Christine Krzyszton

A bevy of brands fall under the Choice Privileges program, from Econo Lodge to Clarion. Better yet, reward nights start at just 8,000 points per night. By transferring 15,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points to Choice Privileges, you’ll receive 30,000 Choice points, which can be enough for 3 free nights at budget-friendly hotels.

For more straightforward redemption ideas, you can use 15,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points to get $150 in cash rewards, $150 in gift cards, or $150 in travel booked via the Wells Fargo Rewards.

9. What Is the Value of 20K Points Worth?

According to our valuations, 20,000 Wells Fargo Points are worth $300.

It’s possible to book premium cabin flights with as few as 20,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points. Remember our handy transfer partner, British Airways Executive Club? You can redeem 16,500 Avios for a one-way business class ticket for American and Alaska flights that are 651 to 1,151 miles in length.

Let’s look at a real-world example here. We found an American Airlines flight from Philadelphia (PHL) to Miami (MIA) in first class that costs $700 one-way. While you won’t get a lie-flat seat, you’ll get to sit up front in domestic first class by transferring 16,500 Wells Fargo Rewards points to British Airways Avios to book this ticket. That’s a value of over 4 cents per point!

We love using British Airways Avios for domestic flights! Image Credit: Stella Shon

If you prefer to book hotels, transferring 20,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points to Choice Privileges can get you 40,000 Choice Privileges points. You can get as many as 5 free hotel nights thanks to the favorable 1:2 ratio.

In other cases, you can spend 20,000 points for $200 in cash rewards, $200 in gift cards, or $200 in travel booked through Wells Fargo Rewards.

Hot Tip: While you may not get amazing value for booking flights directly through Wells Fargo Rewards, you’ll earn airline miles for the cost of the ticket. That’s because these bookings are considered cash redemptions. Make sure to add your frequent flyer number to your booking to collect those miles!

10. How Much Are 30K Rewards Points Worth?

According to our valuations, 30,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points are worth around $450.

Having 30,000 points is enough to book a one-way flight to Europe with Wells Fargo’s transfer partner, Air France-KLM Flying Blue. Points transfer instantly at a 1:1 ratio to the joint frequent flyer program.

If you can find saver availability, you can book flights from many U.S. cities to Paris or Amsterdam from 20,000 Flying Blue miles. Tack on another European city to the itinerary (like Rome or Barcelona), and you can book a one-way flight with a quick layover for under 30,000 miles.

Air France 777-300ER economy class. Image Credit: Michael Y. Park

You can also transfer your Wells Fargo points to Choice Privileges to book a high-end stay with Preferred Hotels, which could easily be worth upwards of $1,000. Thanks to the 1:2 ratio, transferring 30,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points would get you 60,000 Choice Privileges points.

You can also use 30,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points for $300 in cash rewards, $300 in gift cards, or $300 in Wells Fargo Rewards bookings.

11. What Is Our Valuation of 60K Rewards Points?

According to our valuations, 60,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points are worth $900.

There are many ways to get outsized value beyond these estimations.

Before we dive in, it’s possible to earn such a large sum of rewards with the welcome offer on the Wells Fargo Autograph Journey card: Earn 60,000 points after spending $4,000 in purchases in the first 3 months. Once you’ve earned such a large sum of points, you’ll get terrific value by transferring points to airline partners for international business class travel.

There are several ways to book international business class travel for under 60,000 Wells Fargo points. You could transfer 50,000 to 55,000 points to Air France-KLM Flying Blue and book a one-way business class flight to Europe, which routinely sells for $5,000 or more.

Book business class to Paris for just 50,000 miles. Image Credit: Air France

Likewise, Avianca LifeMiles has a sweet spot on one-way TAP Air Portugal flights between New York (JFK) and Lisbon (LIS). It’s possible to book this business class ticket for just 35,000 miles and $27.80 in taxes and fees.

One of the lowest business class fares to Europe you’ll ever find. Image Credit: LifeMiles

You’ll have more than enough to book a one-way business class flight to Spain through Iberia Plus at just 34,000 points, and almost enough for the entire round-trip ticket of at least 68,000 points.

Another affordable way to get to Europe in business class. Image Credit: Iberia

Lastly, you could transfer 60,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points to get 120,000 Choice Privileges points. If you love luxury hotels, you could book more than 3 nights at a Preferred Hotels property — which could offer $1,200 or more in value.

If you don’t use your 60,000 points for travel partners, you could get $600 in cash rewards, $600 in gift cards, or $600 in bookings made with Wells Fargo Rewards.

12. How Much Are 80K Wells Fargo Points Worth?

According to our valuations, 80,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points are worth $1,200.

Having 80,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points can take you on a one-way business class flight to the Middle East, Africa, or Southeast Asia. For example, you can transfer 70,000 points to British Airways Avios to book Qatar Airways Qsuite from New York (JFK) to Doha (DOH).

Image Credit: British Airways

Alternatively, you could transfer 80,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points to Choice Privileges and get 160,000 points. That’s more than enough to book 5 nights at the Hotel Aquarius Venice, Ascend Hotel Collection, in Italy, which costs just 31,000 points per night.

Image Credit: Choice Hotels

Otherwise, those points would be worth $800 in cash rewards, $800 in gift cards, or $800 in Wells Fargo Rewards bookings.

13. How Many Wells Fargo Points Equal a Dollar?

Purely speaking in terms of cash rewards, you’ll need 100 Wells Fargo Rewards points to get a dollar of value. You can get cash rewards from a Wells Fargo ATM if you have an eligible Wells Fargo debit card and receive a statement credit to your account, among other ways to get cash rewards.

The same principle applies if you’re redeeming points for gift cards or travel booked through Wells Fargo. To get a dollar of value, you’ll need 100 Wells Fargo Rewards points.

Award travel is a bit different and will depend on the transfer partner you decide to leverage. It will range from anywhere between 10 to 50 Wells Fargo Rewards points to get a dollar of value.

14. What Can You Use Wells Fargo Rewards Points For?

Wells Fargo Rewards points can be used for several redemption options. The only way to get outsized value greater than 1 cent of value per point is to transfer points to travel partners, while other options give you a flat rate of 1 cent apiece.

Transfer points to airline and hotel partners, which include Aer Lingus AerClub, Air France-KLM Flying Blue, Avianca LifeMiles, Choice Privileges, British Airways Executive Club, and Iberia Plus

which include Aer Lingus AerClub, Air France-KLM Flying Blue, Avianca LifeMiles, Choice Privileges, British Airways Executive Club, and Iberia Plus Cash rewards

Online merchandise at select retailers

Gift cards

Redeem to your Wells Fargo account

Redeem for purchases on your credit card statement

Pay with rewards at PayPal

15. How Much Are Wells Fargo Rewards Points Worth for Travel?

While we provide a lowball estimate of 1.5 cents per point when redeeming Wells Fargo Rewards points with transfer partners, the reality is that you can often get much greater value than our baseline.

When booking business and first class award flights, Wells Fargo Rewards points can be worth at least 5 cents per point. Likewise, you can leverage the excellent 1:2 transfer rate to Choice Privileges to book hotels for at least 2 to 3 cents per point in value when booking luxury properties.

However, when booking hotels, flights, car rentals, cruises, vacation packages, and attractions through the Wells Fargo Rewards portal, you’ll only get 1 cent per point of value.

16. How Much Are Wells Fargo Rewards Points Worth in Cash?

Wells Fargo Rewards points are worth 1 cent each for cash rewards. You can redeem rewards to your Wells Fargo account, redeem for purchases on your statement credit, and more.

Depending on the redemption method, there may be a minimum requirement to get cash rewards. For instance, you’ll need at least 2,500 points to get $25 in the form of a check. And, if you’re getting cash from a Wells Fargo ATM with an eligible Wells Fargo checking account, you can only get cash rewards in $20 increments.

20. How Many Rewards Points Equal a Gift Card?

In general, you can redeem Wells Fargo Rewards points at 1 cent each for gift cards. However, the issuer will often have sales on gift cards through the rewards portal, which can sometimes bring the value slightly up for these redemptions.

You can redeem your points for gift cards, but it’s not always a good idea. Image Credit: Wells Fargo

Expect 1 cent of value per point when redeeming points for gift cards. There will usually be a minimum and a maximum amount, depending on the retailer.

21. How Much Are Rewards Points Worth When You Transfer to Partners?

Wells Fargo Rewards points can be worth a fantastic amount of money when you transfer to travel partners. You can get up to 10 cents per point when you do so.

Qatar Qsuite. Image Credit: Greg Stone

One example of this is to transfer 70,000 Wells Fargo Rewards points to British Airways Avios and book a one-way, $8,000 Qatar Airways Qsuite flight. You can score an amazing redemption value of more than 10 cents per point!

22. Do Wells Fargo Rewards Points Expire?

Wells Fargo Rewards points will not expire as long as you keep your credit card account open and active and it remains in good standing.

23. How Can You Maximize Wells Fargo Rewards Points?

In our view, the best way to use Wells Fargo Rewards points is to transfer them to airline and hotel travel partners. This is the only true way to maximize your rewards for incredible value.

Here are some fantastic uses of Wells Fargo Rewards points:

Transfer points to Choice Privileges at a 1:2 ratio for Preferred Hotels stays, including Cavallo Point in San Francisco, The Capitol Hotel Tokyu in Japan, and many more.

Transfer points to Air France-KLM Flying Blue for business class flights to Europe on Air France, KLM, or Virgin Atlantic.

Transfer points to British Airways Avios for domestic flights on American Airlines and Alaska Airlines or business class flights on Oneworld alliance partners like Qatar Airways and Qantas.

Transfer points to Avianca LifeMiles for short-haul flights on United Airlines and Air Canada or business and first class flights on Star Alliance partners such as Lufthansa and Turkish Airlines.

Transfer points to Iberia Avios to book economy, premium economy, and business class flights on the Spanish flag carrier.

Transfer points to Aer Lingus AerClub to book economy and business class flights to Ireland and intra-Europe flights.

24. Are Wells Fargo Points or Chase Points Better?

In terms of our valuations, Chase Ultimate Rewards points are better than Wells Fargo Rewards points. We value Chase Ultimate Rewards points at 2.0 cents each, while we value Wells Fargo points at 1.5 cents each.

Although Wells Fargo has a neat 1:2 transfer partnership with Choice Privileges, Chase has 1:1 transfer partnerships with World of Hyatt and popular domestic airline programs JetBlue TrueBlue, Southwest Rapid Rewards, and United Airlines MileagePlus.

In contrast, Wells Fargo does not have any domestic airline transfer partners. However, leveraging international transfer partnerships is a fantastic way to get maximum value from your rewards.

Hot Tip: We recommend diversifying your points and miles stash. Many of Wells Fargo and Chase’s transfer partners overlap, so it’s good to collect more points in each program.

25. Are Wells Fargo Points or Amex Points Better?

We value Amex Membership Rewards points at 2.2 cents each because it has the most transfer partners of any major program, whereas Wells Fargo Rewards points are worth 1.5 cents each. For those reasons, we argue that Amex points are better to have than Wells Fargo points.

Amex has far superior airline transfer partnerships in which you can redeem points for maximum value. These programs include Air Canada Aeroplan, ANA Mileage Club, and Delta SkyMiles. The program also partners with Hilton Honors with an excellent 1:2 ratio, and a 1:1 transfer partnership with Marriott Bonvoy, which are more well known than Choice Privileges.

In our view, Amex points are much more valuable to have because of the seemingly endless ways to redeem them.

26. Are Wells Fargo Points or Citi Points Better?

We value Citi ThankYou Points slightly higher (1.6 cents per point) than Wells Fargo Rewards points (1.5 cents per point).

Citi also has the 1:2 transfer partnership with Choice Privileges, but an increased amount of international partners including Air Canada Aeroplan and Turkish Airlines Miles&Smiles.

Final Thoughts

Adding transfer partners brought Wells Fargo up to speed with competing credit card issuers, and it appears the bank is only just getting started.

While we value Wells Fargo Rewards points at 1.5 cents apiece, it’s more than possible to redeem them for anywhere from 1 to 10 cents or more per point.

You’ll want to avoid any cash rewards, gift card, or online shopping redemption options if you’re interested in high value. It might take some work, but it’s well worth the effort to transfer Wells Fargo Rewards points to airline and hotel partners to book award travel via this route instead.

While Wells Fargo Rewards points aren’t the highest valued credit card points, the program already has some great travel partners that you can maximize now.

7.title: Bleakley Financial Group LLC Increases Stock Holdings in Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC)
7.snippet: Bleakley Financial Group LLC grew its stake in Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC - Free Report) by 6.6% during the 4th quarter, according to the company in...
7.content:
Wells Fargo & Company is a multinational financial services company that has established itself as a prominent player in the global financial industry. Founded in 1852 and headquartered in San Francisco, California, Wells Fargo operates in 35 countries and serves over 70 million customers worldwide. Its rich history and successful mergers and acquisitions have contributed to its significant global presence.

As a comprehensive financial services provider, Wells Fargo offers a wide range of banking, investment, mortgage, and consumer financial services. The company's mission is to satisfy its customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. Wells Fargo aims to achieve this by providing exceptional service, acting with integrity, fostering diversity and inclusion, and contributing positively to the communities it serves.

Wells Fargo's extensive product and service portfolio caters to various market segments. The company serves individual consumers, small businesses, corporations, and institutional investors. Its key customers encompass a broad spectrum, ranging from everyday banking customers to high-net-worth individuals and large corporations. Wells Fargo aims to meet the diverse financial needs of its customers through personalized solutions and innovative offerings.

The company has achieved several notable milestones and received recognition for its contributions to the financial industry. Wells Fargo has been ranked as one of the "Big Four Banks" in the United States, alongside JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, and Citigroup. It is also recognized as one of the largest banks in the country by total assets, deposits, and market capitalization. Wells Fargo's commitment to delivering quality financial services has earned it a position among the most valuable bank brands.

Wells Fargo is led by an experienced and capable management team that guides the company's operations and strategic direction. The leadership team consists of individuals with diverse backgrounds and extensive finance, banking, technology, risk management, and customer service expertise. The Chief Executive Officer and President of Wells Fargo is Charles W. Scharf, who brings a wealth of experience in the financial industry. The management team also includes key executives such as Michael J. Santomassimo as the Chief Financial Officer and Scott Powell as the Chief Operating Officer. Each management team member contributes their professional background, accomplishments, and expertise to ensure the company's success.

Wells Fargo has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the years, driven by its diverse business segments and strategic initiatives. The company has reported steady revenue growth, reflecting its ability to attract and retain a large customer base. Wells Fargo's revenue metrics indicate its success in generating income through its various financial services and product offerings.

Earnings metrics illustrate the company's profitability and stability. Wells Fargo's focus on prudent risk management practices and diversified revenue streams contributes to its ability to generate sustainable earnings. Profit margin metrics showcase the efficiency of Wells Fargo's operations. The company's ability to manage costs effectively while generating revenue is key to maintaining healthy profit margins. Debt levels play a significant role in evaluating the company's financial position. Wells Fargo's management strives to maintain a conservative approach to managing debt, ensuring a strong balance sheet and financial stability.

Wells Fargo's valuation metrics are influenced by a range of factors, including its market position, financial performance, growth prospects, risk profile, and investor sentiment. Factors driving Wells Fargo's valuation include its brand recognition, customer base, diversified business segments, and ability to generate consistent earnings. Changes in investor sentiment, market conditions, and regulatory developments can also impact the company's valuation over time.

Investors closely monitor Wells Fargo's stock performance, assessing its ability to deliver value over the long term. The stock has had issues in the past due to news or events that have affected the company's share price, such as regulatory actions, the global pandemic, and strategic initiatives. These factors should be considered in analyzing its market performance.

Wells Fargo operates in the highly competitive financial services industry, which is subject to evolving regulatory frameworks and technological advancements. Understanding the broader industry in which the company operates is crucial to assessing its competitive positioning.

Wells Fargo competes with other major banks and financial institutions domestically and internationally. The company leverages its brand recognition, extensive product and service offerings, customer relationships, and technological capabilities to gain a competitive advantage. However, it also faces challenges such as regulatory compliance, changing customer preferences, and disruptive market forces.

Wells Fargo has identified several growth opportunities within its diverse business segments. The company aims to deepen relationships with existing customers, attract new customers and expand its presence in key markets. In consumer banking, Wells Fargo focuses on enhancing digital capabilities, improving customer experience, and providing innovative solutions to meet evolving customer needs. The company seeks to leverage its strong brand and customer base to drive growth and increase customer loyalty. In wealth and investment management, Wells Fargo aims to capitalize on the growing demand for comprehensive financial planning and advisory services. The company's expertise in wealth management positions it well to capture opportunities in an increasingly complex investment landscape.

As with any financial institution, Wells Fargo faces various risks and challenges. It is important to comprehensively analyze potential risks and challenges to understand their potential impact on the company's performance. Factors such as regulatory changes, cybersecurity threats, economic downturns, and reputational risks pose challenges to Wells Fargo's operations. The company has implemented robust risk management strategies, invested in technology and security measures, and enhanced compliance frameworks to mitigate these risks. Ongoing efforts to prioritize ethical conduct, transparency, and stakeholder trust are integral to managing risks effectively.

8.title: 11 Best Ways To Earn Lots of Wells Fargo Rewards Points [2024]
8.snippet: There are plenty of ways to earn Wells Fargo Rewards points with personal credit cards, from spending on everyday purchases to annual vacations.
8.content:
Although Wells Fargo Rewards has been around for quite some time, airline and hotel transfer partners were just recently introduced to the program.

Along with this game-changing update, Wells Fargo debuted its first travel rewards credit card: the Wells Fargo Autograph Journey℠ Card. The card offers excellent returns on travel purchases, such as unlimited 5x points on hotels and 4x points on airfare, among other valuable bonus categories.

For these reasons, Wells Fargo is finally catching up with popular credit card programs like Chase Ultimate Rewards and American Express Membership Rewards. In this in-depth guide, we’ll discuss how you can earn Wells Fargo Rewards points for your next redemption.

About Wells Fargo Rewards Points

Wells Fargo has a portfolio of credit cards, many of which earn points that can be used for travel, cash rewards, gift cards, and more. Here are the core reasons why you may want to set your sights on earning Wells Fargo Rewards points.

Transfer Your Wells Fargo Rewards Points to Airline and Hotel Partners

You can book a lie-flat seat to Europe with your Wells Fargo Rewards points. Image Credit: Daniel Ross

For a long time, Wells Fargo hasn’t offered any travel transfer partners. That all changed earlier in 2024 when the major issuer announced its initial list of participating airline and hotel programs.

You can transfer your points at a 1:1 ratio to most partners, giving you maximum flexibility to book flights across airlines from all alliances (Oneworld, SkyTeam, and Star Alliance). Here are some of the options cardholders have to redeem their points:

Redeem rewards at any time with a minimum of 1 point and a maximum of 999,999 points per transaction.

Transfer rewards to the loyalty programs of the Wells Fargo travel partners.

Transfer rewards between business and personal Wells Fargo accounts.

Transfer rewards between cash rewards and points-earning Wells Fargo accounts.

Use a combination of points and cash for travel purchases on the Wells Fargo portal.

Redeem points for cash, gift cards, and more.

Ease of Earning Wells Fargo Rewards

Wells Fargo has a couple of travel rewards cards in its Autograph family, and holding one of these cards allows you to transfer your points to the issuer’s airline and hotel partners.

In addition, if you have the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card, which earns cash rewards, you can transfer rewards to the Wells Fargo Autograph Journey card or the Wells Fargo Autograph℠ Card to become fully fledged transferable points. As such, you can earn Wells Fargo Rewards points effortlessly in several ways that we’ll go over in further detail throughout the article:

Every purchase made earns Wells Fargo Rewards points.

Bonus category purchases allow you to earn up to 5x rewards.

Generous welcome bonus offers to earn lots of rewards upon meeting minimum spend requirements.

Earning With Wells Fargo Personal Cards

There are plenty of ways to earn Wells Fargo Rewards points with personal credit cards, from spending on everyday purchases to annual vacations. Here’s a closer look at all the ways to earn Wells Fargo Rewards points with personal cards.

Personal Cards That Earn Wells Fargo Rewards Points

The 2 personal cards that earn Wells Fargo Rewards points are part of the Autograph family. Let’s compare the rewards, features, and benefits of each card.

Wells Fargo Autograph Journey℠ Card U.P. Rating The rating for this card has been determined by our own industry experts who know the ins and outs of credit card products. Bonuses, rewards as well as rates and fees are all taken into account. Compensation from the issuer does not affect our rating. We only recommend products we either use ourselves or endorse. A powerful point earning card with access to transfer partners. Wells Fargo Autograph Journey℠ Card A powerful point earning card with access to transfer partners. Welcome Offer Earn 60,000 bonus points when you spend $4,000 in purchases in the first 3 months – that’s $600 toward your next trip. 60,000 points UP's Offer Valuation*: $900 Annual Fee $95 APR 20.24%, 25.24%, or 29.24% Variable APR Credit Recommended Upgraded Points credit ranges are a variation of FICO®Score 8, one of many types of credit scores lenders may use when considering your credit cardapplication. Good to Excellent (670-850) Why We Like This Card The Wells Fargo Autograph JourneySM Card is an excellent option for those looking for a great all-around travel rewards card that offers bonus categories on hotels, airfare, travel, and dining, giving you the opportunity to earn points on these purchases quickly. Plus the card offers flexible redemption options including access to transfer partners, an annual statement credit with airfare purchase, and no foreign transaction fees. Pros & Cons Pros Earn 5x points on hotels

Earn 4x points on airfare

Earn 3x points on other travel and restaurants; 1x on other purchases Cons $95 annual fee

List of transfer partners is smaller than competing programs Read Full Review Card Highlights Select “Learn More” to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

Bonuses, rewards as well as rates and fees are all taken into account. Compensation from the issuer does not affect our rating. We only recommend products we either use ourselves or endorse. The Wells Fargo Autograph Card offers great 3x bonus points and cell phone protection with no annual fee. Wells Fargo Autograph℠ Card The Wells Fargo Autograph Card offers great 3x bonus points and cell phone protection with no annual fee. Good to Excellent (670-850) Why We Like This Card The Wells Fargo Autograph℠ Card is an excellent no annual fee card that offers 3x points on 6 different bonus categories. Choose from multiple options when you’re ready to redeem your rewards, and take advantage of great perks including cell phone protection, auto rental collision damage waiver, and no foreign transaction fees. Pros & Cons Pros 3x points per $1 spent on restaurants, travel, gas stations, transit, popular streaming services, and phone plans

1x points per $1 spent on other purchases

No annual fee Cons Points are worth a fixed 1 cent per point, so it isn’t possible to get outsized value Read Full Review Card Highlights Select “Learn More” to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

Redeem your rewards points for travel, gift cards, or statement credits. Or shop at millions of online stores and redeem your rewards when you check out with PayPal.

Foreign Transaction Fees: None

As mentioned above, the Wells Fargo Active Cash card earns cash rewards that can be converted to Wells Fargo Rewards points if you hold either of the Autograph cards. This could be a winning strategy for many award travelers since the Wells Fargo Active Cash card has $0 annual fee and offers generous 2% cash rewards rate on all eligible purchases.

Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card U.P. Rating The rating for this card has been determined by our own industry experts who know the ins and outs of credit card products. Bonuses, rewards as well as rates and fees are all taken into account. Compensation from the issuer does not affect our rating. We only recommend products we either use ourselves or endorse. The Wells Fargo Active Cash card earns 2% cash rewards on purchases with no annual fee. Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card The Wells Fargo Active Cash card earns 2% cash rewards on purchases with no annual fee. Welcome Offer Earn a $200 cash rewards bonus after spending $500 in purchases in the first 3 months $200 cash rewards bonus Annual Fee $0 APR 0% intro APR for 12 months from account opening on purchases and qualifying balance transfers. 19.24%, 24.24%, or 29.24% Variable APR thereafter. Credit Recommended Upgraded Points credit ranges are a variation of FICO®Score 8, one of many types of credit scores lenders may use when considering your credit cardapplication. Good to Excellent (670-850) Pros & Cons Pros Earn unlimited 2% cash rewards on purchases

No annual fee

0% intro APR for 12 months from account opening on purchases and qualifying balance transfers. 19.24%, 24.24%, or 29.24% Variable APR thereafter (rates & fees) Cons No bonus categories for those who want to optimize certain purchases Read Full Review Card Highlights Select “Learn More” to take advantage of this specific offer and learn more about product features, terms and conditions.

Earn unlimited 2% cash rewards on purchases.
