The team had formerly managed roughly $345 million at Ameriprise.Jackson/Roskelley was founded in 1994 by Bob Jackson, who brought Roskelley in as a shareholder in 2006. Roskelley eventually became president and CEO of the firm and Jackson retired. Robertson joined in 2015 and now holds the title of managing director.Before joining Ameriprise in 2023,with Raymond James for seven years, Cambridge Investment Research for nine years before, after being with various firms at the start of his career.at Ameriprise in 2023 and was at Raymond James for seven years before that. He too came to Raymond James from Cambridge Investment, which he joined in 2015 from Charles Schwab.LPL and Ameriprise have been embroiled inover the past year over their recruiting practices. Ameriprise tookat LPL in July, accusing its industry rival of engaging in a "widespread pattern and practice of harvesting and misappropriating Ameriprise's private, confidential client information and trade secrets." The two firmsto bring in a third-party forensic consultant to preserve evidence in the dispute pending its resolution in FINRA arbitration.

8.title: How To Open a CD Account With Wells Fargo
8.snippet: In-Branch Application. To open an account in person, visit a local Wells Fargo branch location. You'll need: ... Every Wells Fargo CD has a minimum deposit...
8.content:
Commitment to Our Readers GOBankingRates' editorial team is committed to bringing you unbiased reviews and information. We use data-driven methodologies to evaluate financial products and services - our reviews and ratings are not influenced by advertisers. You can read more about our editorial guidelines and our products and services review methodology. 20 Years

Helping You Live Richer Reviewed

by Experts Trusted by

Millions of Readers

Certificates of deposit are financial products that pay a fixed interest rate over a set period of time. Wells Fargo offers CDs with daily compounding interest so you can watch your money grow without taking on the risks that come with many other investment options. Read on to learn everything you need to know to open a CD account with Wells Fargo.

How To Open a CD Account With Wells Fargo

You can open a Wells Fargo CD account online or in person at a local bank branch. Opening an account online is quick and convenient, but you’ll have a wider selection of terms available if you open an account in person, including terms up to 120 months.

You can fund a Wells Fargo CD by:

Transferring money from a Wells Fargo account.

Transferring money from a non-Wells Fargo account using your account and routing numbers.

Using a check or money order.

Online Application

When you open an account online, you’ll need the same items as when you visit in person:

ID

Social Security number or ITIN

Money to fund your account

If you use a check or money order to open an online account, you must mail it in after completing your application.

To get started, you’ll fill out an application on the website. This will include questions about:

Whether you’re opening an individual or joint account.

If you’re a Wells Fargo banking customer.

Information from your driver’s license or government-issued ID.

Citizenship status.

Contact information, including address, phone number and email address.

How long you’ve lived at your present address.

Your occupation.

After you fill out your information, you’ll need to review and accept the bank’s terms and conditions. It’s important to read this fine print to avoid getting stuck with an account that doesn’t match your needs. If you want to open a joint account, you’ll have to provide information for both you and the other person on the CD to finalize the account set up.

Before opening your account, Wells Fargo may order a credit report, but this won’t affect your credit score.

If you have questions or need help setting up your online CD account, you can call 800-869-3557 to speak to a Wells Fargo agent.

In-Branch Application

To open an account in person, visit a local Wells Fargo branch location. You’ll need:

A valid ID

Your Social Security number or ITIN

The funds to open your account

Every Wells Fargo CD has a minimum deposit requirement of either $2,500, $5,000 or $10,000. You can use the Wells Fargo website to find a nearby branch location and make an appointment to open a CD account in person. While it’s possible to show up at the branch, it’s a good idea to make an appointment to avoid waiting too long for assistance.

Types of CD Accounts Offered by Wells Fargo

You can select from a wide variety of Wells Fargo CDs, all with different term lengths, interest rates and minimum deposit amounts. Broadly, Wells Fargo offers Special and Standard Fixed Rate CDs, which have advantages and disadvantages.

Standard CDs offer the convenience of a lower minimum deposit and a fixed term length and interest rate. But the APY on this type of CD is typically lower than those on Special Fixed Rate CDs.

Here’s a closer look at both:

Feature Special Fixed Rate CDs Standard Fixed Rate CDs Term lengths 7, 11 or 18 months 3, 6 or 12 months online; up to 120 months in person Interest rates More competitive Less competitive Minimum deposit $5,000 $2,500

Interest rates vary and are subject to change anytime until you open the CD. Check the Wells Fargo website for the most current rates.

When you open a CD account, you’ll know exactly how much interest your money will earn over the term length. And you’re guaranteed your initial deposit as long as you leave it in the CD for the full term.

Term lengths for CD accounts opened online range from three months to one year. If you link an eligible Wells Fargo banking account, you’ll earn a Relationship Interest Rate. This rate is higher than the standard interest rate offered on CDs.

When your Wells Fargo certificate of deposit matures, you’ll have seven calendar days to close your account or make other changes, including:

Changing the account term.

Making additional deposits.

Making withdrawals.

Minimum Deposit Requirements and Terms

Depending on the type of CD you open, your minimum deposit could be $2,500 or $5,000 or even $10,000. Special or promotional rate CDs tend to have higher minimum deposit amounts, but also typically offer a better interest rate.

The higher your deposit, the more interest you’ll earn over the term of the CD. Similarly, a longer term results in more earnings, as interest is compounded daily.

Early Withdrawal Penalties and Terms

If you withdraw funds from the CD before its maturity date, Wells Fargo will charge an early withdrawal penalty fee. This fee varies based on the CD’s term length and when you make the withdrawal.

The early withdrawal penalties are broken down below by term length:

90 days or less: Penalty equal to one month’s worth of interest

Penalty equal to one month’s worth of interest Between 90 to 365 days: Penalty equal to 3 months’ worth of interest

Penalty equal to 3 months’ worth of interest Between 12 and 24 months: Penalty equal to 6 months’ worth of interest

Penalty equal to 6 months’ worth of interest Over 24 months: Penalty equal to 12 months’ worth of interest

To avoid early withdrawal penalties, consider opening a CD with a shorter term if there’s a possibility you’ll need the money soon. Shorter terms come with lower penalty fees, as well, so even if you unexpectedly have to take your money out, you won’t be stung as hard.

Pros and Cons of Opening a CD Account With Wells Fargo

As with financial products from any institution, Wells Fargo CDs have pros and cons you should consider before you decide to open one.

Wells Fargo CD Pros:

Competitive interest rates

Ability to open a CD online or in-branch

Trusted national bank

FDIC insured up to maximum limits

Wells Fargo CD Cons:

Limited flexibility with CD terms

Relatively high minimum deposits required

Penalties for early withdrawals can be steep

Must visit a branch to access full selection of CD options

Conclusion: Is a Wells Fargo CD Right for You?

Thanks to its fixed interest rate and set term, a CD lets you earn more interest than you typically would from a traditional savings account or checking account. It also allows your money to grow without the risk inherent to investments in the stock market.

Wells Fargo lets you pick from different term lengths, so you can find a CD that matches your needs. To open a Wells Fargo CD account, visit your local Wells Fargo branch or open an account online on the Wells Fargo website.

FAQ Here are the answers to some commonly asked questions about Wells Fargo CD accounts. What documents are required to open a CD account with Wells Fargo? To open a CD account with Wells Fargo, you'll need a government-issued ID, Social Security number and contact information. You'll also need the funds for your deposit, subject to minimums.

Can I open a Wells Fargo CD online or do I need to visit a branch? You can open a Wells Fargo CD online, although if you prefer visiting a branch that's an option, too.

What is the minimum deposit for a Wells Fargo CD? The minimum deposit for a Wells Fargo CD is $2,500, although some types of CDs require at least $5,000 or $10,000.

Does Wells Fargo offer special CD promotions or higher rates for new customers? Wells Fargo offers promotional, special fixed rate CDs with higher APYs than standard CDs which could be appealing to new customers. Existing customers with eligible Wells Fargo accounts may qualify for a Relationship Interest Rate, which is slightly higher than CD rates offered to non-customers.

Here are the answers to some commonly asked questions about Wells Fargo CD accounts.

Sarah Sharkey and Jasmin Baron contributed to the reporting for this article.

Information is accurate as of Feb. 7, 2025.

Editorial Note: This content is not provided by any entity covered in this article. Any opinions, analyses, reviews, ratings or recommendations expressed in this article are those of the author alone and have not been reviewed, approved or otherwise endorsed by any entity named in this article.

AUSTIN, Texas--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Q2 Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: QTWO), a leading provider of digital transformation solutions for financial services, today announced that Wells Fargo (NYSE: WFC) has launched a commercial banking platform designed to improve bankers’ ability to serve commercial clients, and increase collaboration and efficiency.

“Wells Fargo is committed to delivering superior value to our commercial banking clients,” said Mary Katherine Dubose, EVP and Head of Commercial Banking Specialized Industries, Wells Fargo. “We are excited to partner with Q2 on this important initiative and to have successfully completed the initial phases of Q2’s implementation. This new solution enables our teams to serve our customers with the agility and insights required in an increasingly dynamic market.”

Q2’s solution is trusted by more than 30,000 bankers across 140 leading financial institutions, including more than half of the 15 largest banks in North America.

“We are excited to partner with Wells Fargo to transform and enhance the experience they provide to their commercial clients,” said Q2 President Kirk Coleman. “Q2 empowers client relationship teams with actionable, real-time insights and coaching to deliver exceptional service across products.”

As a leader in commercial relationship solutions, Q2 helps financial institutions of all sizes analyze millions of relationships annually. Its virtual insights analyst, Andi®, augments bankers’ strengths with the latest technology, data and insights.

Q2 is a leading provider of digital transformation solutions for financial services, serving banks, credit unions, alternative finance companies, and fintechs in the U.S. and internationally. Q2 enables its financial institution and fintech customers to provide comprehensive, data-driven digital engagement solutions for consumers, small businesses and corporate clients. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Q2 has offices worldwide and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the stock symbol QTWO. To learn more, please visit Q2.com. Rewards: Unlimited 2% cash back on all purchases. That's a higher ongoing rate than the standard 1.5% flat rate that many rewards cards offer.

Sign-up bonus: Earn a $200 cash rewards bonus after spending $500 in purchases in the first 3 months.

Interest rate: 0% intro APR on Purchases for 12 months and 0% intro APR on Balance Transfers 12 months from account opening on qualifying balance transfers, and then the ongoing APR of 19.24%, 24.24%, or 29.24% Variable APR.

Cell phone insurance: A minor but useful perk, not often found on 2%-back cards.

Taken together, that's an impressive and hard-to-find combination of perks that most other 2% cash-back credit cards just can't match.

Here's a closer look at how the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card stacks up to the market.

Citi Double Cash® Card

NerdWallet rating NerdWallet's ratings are determined by our editorial team. The scoring formula incorporates coverage options, customer experience, customizability, cost and more. Learn More

Annual fee: $0.

Rewards: 2% cash back on all spending: 1% when you make the purchase and another 1% when you pay your bill.

Sign-up bonus: Earn $200 cash back after you spend $1,500 on purchases in the first 6 months of account opening. This bonus offer will be fulfilled as 20,000 ThankYou® Points, which can be redeemed for $200 cash back.

APR: 0% intro APR on balance transfers for 18 months, and then the ongoing APR of 18.24%-28.24% Variable APR.

How it compares with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card: The Citi Double Cash® Card has long been considered best in its class among cards offering flat-rate cash-back rewards for no annual fee. It has been named NerdWallet's best flat-rate cash-back credit card on multiple occasions.

It earns 2% back in the form of 1% when you make a purchase and 1% when you pay it off. However, the card's standard offer doesn't include a welcome bonus like the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card. Plus, with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card, you’ll earn your cash back all at once, not in pieces like you would with the Citi Double Cash® Card.

🤓 Nerdy Tip Although the Citi Double Cash® Card has not traditionally offered a sign-up bonus, the card currently has this offer in effect: Earn $200 cash back after you spend $1,500 on purchases in the first 6 months of account opening. This bonus offer will be fulfilled as 20,000 ThankYou® Points, which can be redeemed for $200 cash back.

If you want to use your rewards for travel, the Citi Double Cash® Card offers more options. That's because you can choose to convert your cash rewards into Citi ThankYou points and then use those points to redeem for travel, or transfer to a host of travel partners.

Although both cards do offer introductory APR periods, the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card wins out with an interest-free window for both purchases and balance transfers. The Citi Double Cash® Card offers an intro APR promotion only for balance transfers.

Alliant Cashback Visa® Signature Credit Card

Annual fee: $0.

Rewards: 2.5% cash back on everything, up to $10,000 in qualifying purchases per billing cycle.

Sign-up bonus: N/A.

APR: The ongoing APR is 12.24% - 12.24% Variable APR.

How it compares with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card: If you meet the account balance requirement, the Alliant Cashback Visa® Signature Credit Card features rewards that can potentially top what most flat-rate rewards cards offer: 2.5% cash back on up to $10,000 in purchases per billing cycle, and 1.5% cash back on all other purchases after that. Although most everyday spending won’t get you near the card’s monthly cap, it does limit how much you can earn — especially if you’re a big spender. By comparison, the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card earns unlimited cash back.

While the Alliant card could earn more rewards, that ability comes with a caveat: You have to maintain a minimum daily account balance of $1,000 in an Alliant High-Rate Checking account to earn the card's 2.5%-back. Cardholders who don't meet this requirement can only earn an unlimited 1.5% cash back on all purchases. There are no such balance requirements to earn rewards with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card.

Another caveat of the Alliant Cashback Visa® Signature Credit Card is the fact that you are required to join the Alliant Credit Union to get it. Although joining the credit union is as simple as becoming a member of an eligible charity, it's another hoop to jump through.

The Alliant Cashback Visa® Signature Credit Card doesn’t charge a foreign transaction fee, whereas the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card does — which can make it costly to travel with.

PayPal Cashback Mastercard®

NerdWallet rating NerdWallet's ratings are determined by our editorial team. The scoring formula incorporates coverage options, customer experience, customizability, cost and more. Learn More

Annual fee: $0.

Rewards: 3% cash back on PayPal purchases, 1.5% back on all other purchases.

APR: The ongoing APR is 19.24%, 30.99%, or 33.99%, Variable APR.

How it compares with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card: Another potentially high-earning, $0-annual-fee flat-rate card is the PayPal Cashback Mastercard®, which offers 3% cash back on all PayPal purchases. However, it earns just a so-so 1.5% back on all other purchases. Plus, you’ll only be able to earn those rewards if you have a PayPal account, and you’ll have to redeem them directly into your PayPal balance. If you already have a PayPal account, this won’t pose much of a hurdle. On the other hand, if you would prefer fewer restrictions and more flexibility when it comes to redeeming your rewards, the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card is a better bet.

Unlike the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card, the PayPal Cashback Mastercard® doesn’t consistently feature an introductory interest-free period.

SoFi Unlimited 2% Credit Card

Annual fee: $0.

Rewards: 2 points per $1 spent on most purchases, plus 3 points per $1 spent on travel booked through SoFi Travel.

Sign-up bonus: Earn a $200 statement credit welcome bonus after you spend $2,000 in purchases in the first 3 months of account opening.

APR: 10.99% intro APR on balance transfers for 6 months from date of first transfer, for transfers that post to your account by February 10, 2024. After the intro APR expires, your APR will be 28.24% Variable.

How it compares with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card: With the exception of higher rewards on very specific travel purchases, the rewards on the SoFi Unlimited 2% Credit Card are virtually identical to those you'll earn on the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card. For most people, choosing between the two cards will come down to whether you'd rather bank with SoFi or Wells Fargo.

Fidelity® Rewards Visa Signature® Card

Annual fee: $0.

Rewards: 2% cash back on all purchases.

Sign-up bonus: None.

APR: The ongoing APR is 13.99% Variable.

How it compares with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card: The $0-annual fee Fidelity® Rewards Visa Signature® Card earns 2% cash back on all purchases, but to get the full cash back, you must deposit rewards into an eligible Fidelity account. Unless you have a qualifying account — such as a retirement account, 529 college savings plan or an health savings account with Fidelity — you’ll earn a paltry points value for non-cash back redemption options with the card.

Conversely, the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card earns the same 2%-back rewards rate without redemption requirements. It also features a useful welcome bonus, unlike the Fidelity® Rewards Visa Signature® Card.

5.title: Is Trending Stock Wells Fargo & Company (WFC) a Buy Now?
5.snippet: Wells Fargo (WFC) has received quite a bit of attention from Zacks.com users lately. Therefore, it is wise to be aware of the facts that can impact the...
5.content:
Wells Fargo (WFC) has recently been on Zacks.com's list of the most searched stocks. Therefore, you might want to consider some of the key factors that could influence the stock's performance in the near future.

Shares of this biggest U.S. mortgage lender have returned +11.9% over the past month versus the Zacks S&P 500 composite's +2.1% change. The Zacks Financial - Investment Bank industry, to which Wells Fargo belongs, has gained 10.4% over this period. Now the key question is: Where could the stock be headed in the near term?

While media releases or rumors about a substantial change in a company's business prospects usually make its stock 'trending' and lead to an immediate price change, there are always some fundamental facts that eventually dominate the buy-and-hold decision-making.

Earnings Estimate Revisions

Here at Zacks, we prioritize appraising the change in the projection of a company's future earnings over anything else. That's because we believe the present value of its future stream of earnings is what determines the fair value for its stock.

We essentially look at how sell-side analysts covering the stock are revising their earnings estimates to reflect the impact of the latest business trends. And if earnings estimates go up for a company, the fair value for its stock goes up. A higher fair value than the current market price drives investors' interest in buying the stock, leading to its price moving higher. This is why empirical research shows a strong correlation between trends in earnings estimate revisions and near-term stock price movements.

For the current quarter, Wells Fargo is expected to post earnings of $1.25 per share, indicating a change of -0.8% from the year-ago quarter. The Zacks Consensus Estimate has changed +4.9% over the last 30 days.

The consensus earnings estimate of $5.84 for the current fiscal year indicates a year-over-year change of +8.8%. This estimate has changed +5.4% over the last 30 days.

For the next fiscal year, the consensus earnings estimate of $6.79 indicates a change of +16.4% from what Wells Fargo is expected to report a year ago. Over the past month, the estimate has changed +6%.

Having a strong externally audited track record, our proprietary stock rating tool, the Zacks Rank, offers a more conclusive picture of a stock's price direction in the near term, since it effectively harnesses the power of earnings estimate revisions. Due to the size of the recent change in the consensus estimate, along with three other factors related to earnings estimates, Wells Fargo is rated Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).

6.title: Man robbed at Wells Fargo ATM
6.snippet: Police in Opa-locaka, Florida are on the lookout for an individual who robbed a man while using a Wells Fargo ATM. The suspect pulled a gun on the victim...
6.content:
Man robbed at Wells Fargo ATM

Photo: Adobe Stock

February 6, 2025

Police in Opa-locaka, Florida are on the lookout for an individual who robbed a man while using a Wells Fargo ATM. The suspect pulled a gun on the victim and demanded cash, according to a report by Local 10.

The robbery took place early in the morning at 5 a.m. Officers arrived on the scene and found a suspect matching the description nearby. The suspect fled on foot.

The investigation is ongoing.

7.title: Live updates: Washington Capitals vs Philadelphia Flyers at Wells Fargo Center
7.snippet: The Washington Capitals have only two games remaining before breaking for a mid-season vacation (since none of their superior players are suiting…
7.content:
The Washington Capitals have only two games remaining before breaking for a mid-season vacation (since none of their superior players are suiting up in the 4 Nations Face Off for reasons I still don’t understand).

Tonight, the Capitals will take on the Philadelphia Flyers in the City of Brotherly Love. The Flyers are wildly shorthanded, which could make this game a potential blowout.

Ivan Fedotov will start in net for the Flyers (new goalie alert) while Charlie Lindgren will get back into the twine for the Caps.

The Capitals-Flyers game is airing on Monumental Sports Network. Joe Beninati and Alan May will have the call. Puck drop is a little after 7:00 pm. Craig Laughlin is out due to a medical leave of absence. #LockerStrong.

Lines

Washington Capitals

Ovechkin Strome Wilson Protas Dubois McMichael Raddysh Eller Frank Duhaime Dowd Mangiapane Sandin Carlson Fehervary Roy Chychrun TVR Lindgren Thompson

Philadelphia Flyers

Foerster Cates Brink Laughton Abols Konecny Richard Couturier Michkov Deslauriers Gaucher Hathaway York Sanheim Seeler Drysdale Andrae Johnson Fedotov Ersson

Tunnel shenanigans

1st Period

Puck is dropped.

Capitals haven’t made a single entry with control yet.

Capitals give up a semi-breakaway forcing Rasmus Sandin to hook Matvei Michkov from point-blank range at 4:03.

Capitals kill the penalty.

Tom Wilson sprung on a breakaway after a bit hit by Alex Ovechkin. Wilson tries to go five-hole but Fedotov makes the save. Ovechkin tries to get to the rebound, but can’t, instead checking a Flyers defender hard into the net. Play is whistled dead as the goal is put back on its pegs. That was the Capitals first shot on goal. It came 7:23 into the first period.

Midway through the period, Dylan Strome is partially sprung, but his backhand is stopped by Fedotov who comes out to challenge.

Taylor Raddysh draws a tripping penalty on Emil Andrae at 12:41. Raddysh was flying down the wing and Andrae swung his stick out to swipe at the puck.

Ovi gets a wide-open one-timer but Fedotov gets his right pad on the shot. The shot came in low to the ice. Ovi seems frustrated on the miss.

🚨 1-0 Philadelphia Flyers. PHI Goal: Matvei Michkov (15). Assists: T. Sanheim (20). Time: 17:31.

Matvei Michkov, who was definitely not cherry-picking, scores easily on a breakaway, beating Charlie Lindgren glove-side and over the pad. 1-0 Flyers.

🚨 1-1 tie. WSH Goal: Alex Ovechkin (26). Assists: M. Fehervary (12), D. Strome (37). Time: 19:07.

At intermission: The two teams are tied in shots on goal 7-7 and the Flyers have a slight edge 14-13 in 5v5 shot attempts. The Capitals are 15-2-2 this season when tied after the first period.

2nd Period

Puck is dropped.

Erik Johnson to the box at 2:11 for delay of game – shooting the puck off the rink.

Garnet Hathaway gets the first opportunity of the Caps power play, nearly shooting shorthanded after Alex Ovechkin lets him go for a breakaway. Lindgren stopped Hathaway who went to his backhand in an attempt to score. That’s Lindgren’s seventh stop of the night and it’s another big one.

🚨 2-1 Washington Capitals. WSH Goal: Connor McMichael (19). Assists: A. Protas (24), J. Chychrun (21). Time: 04:17.

Connor McMichael scores on a deflection in front of the net after a sensational pass by Aliaksei Protas. It’s his 19th of the season. The goal came right as a Capitals power play ended.

TVR to the box for tripping at 5:47. He turned the puck over and immediately tripped Anthony Richard as he drove hard to the net.

🚨 2-2 tie. PHI PPG: Tyson Foerster (15). Assists: E. Andrae (5), T. Konecny (38). Time: 07:23.

Tyson Foerster deflects an Emil Andrae point shot past Charlie Lindgren on the power play.

🚨 3-2 tie. PHI Goal: Matvei Michkov (16). Assists: E. Andrae (5), T. Konecny (38). Time: 07:23.

Michkov with his second of the night after a great passing play finds him in front of the net for a tap-in.

Flyers chance hits the post.

Another great chance for Michkov but he whiffs on his attempt.

At intermission: The Flyers lead in shots 13-11 and 24-23 in 5v5 shot attempts.

3rd Period

The zambonis are coming back out causing a five minute delay before the start of the third period.

Puck is dropped.

Big glove save by Charlie Lindgren on Travis Sanheim 1:10 into the period. Capitals seemed to be confused if the play would be an icing or not.

Holy F – Michkov nearly scored on a Michigan but Lindgren somehow stops it. He was so quick and smooth doing it from behind the net.

🚨 3-3 tie. WSH Goal: Lars Eller (10). Assists: T. Raddysh (15). Time: 06:23.

Eller goes off the post and in. That was a huge goal.

🚨 4-3 Washington Capitals. WSH Goal: Jakob Chychrun (14). Assists: J. Carlson (30), T. Raddysh (16). Time: 12:05.

Jakob Chychrun with a huge slap shot that beats Ivan Fedotov, giving the Capitals a 4-3 lead. What a cross-ice pass by John Carlson to find him.

Flyers pull Fedotov with around 2:00 remaining.

Charlie Lindgren makes an insane stop at the buzzer with his left pad. Wow. Electric!

Capitals win 4-3. Flyers outshoot the Caps 22-18 and out-attempt them 42-34 at 5v5.

Comment below. Refresh for live updates during the game. The thread will be closed shortly after the game is completed.

8.title: Wells Fargo Bonus Offers and Promotions
8.snippet: With the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card, you can enjoy unlimited 2% cash back on all purchases, with no restrictive spending categories or annual fees.
8.content:
13-Smile / Getty Images/iStockphoto

Commitment to Our Readers GOBankingRates' editorial team is committed to bringing you unbiased reviews and information. We use data-driven methodologies to evaluate financial products and services - our reviews and ratings are not influenced by advertisers. You can read more about our editorial guidelines and our products and services review methodology. 20 Years

Helping You Live Richer Reviewed

by Experts Trusted by

Millions of Readers

All banks want your business, and they’re willing to pay you money for opening a bank account, often with special incentives for new customers. Wells Fargo promotions are no exception. In some cases, you can earn hundreds of dollars from Wells Fargo bonus offers to start or boost your savings.

Here’s everything you need to know about Wells Fargo bank bonuses.

Current Wells Fargo Bank Promotions

If you’re looking for a new checking account, consider one offered by a trusted bank that offers rewards when you sign up. Here are the details on how you can earn a Wells Fargo checking account bonus or savings account bonus.

Account Bonus Amount Expiration Date Wells Fargo Everyday Checking Account $300 April 16, 2025 Wells Fargo Premier Checking Account $2,500 April 16, 2025 Wells Fargo Savings Account $525 April 8, 2025

Wells Fargo Everyday Checking Account: $300 Bonus

Wouldn’t it be nice if your next Wells Fargo ATM visit included some extra cash in your bank account? There are many checking accounts out there, but signing up for one with a $300 bonus might just be a reason to become a Wells Fargo customer.

Bonus value: $300

$300 Minimum opening deposit: $25

$25 Expiration date: April 16, 2025

How to claim: Open an Everyday Checking account as a new customer through the offer webpage. After opening your account, you must receive $1,000 or more in qualifying electronic deposits within 90 days.

Open an Everyday Checking account as a new customer through the offer webpage. After opening your account, you must receive $1,000 or more in qualifying electronic deposits within 90 days. When you’ll get it: After a 90-day qualification period has passed and you’ve met the requirements, Wells Fargo will deposit any earned bonus into your new checking account within 30 days of approval.

After a 90-day qualification period has passed and you’ve met the requirements, Wells Fargo will deposit any earned bonus into your new checking account within 30 days of approval. Terms and conditions: You’re not eligible for this bonus if you are a Wells Fargo employee, are a current owner of a Wells Fargo consumer checking account or have already received a bonus for opening a Wells Fargo consumer checking account in the past 12 months.

You’re not eligible for this bonus if you are a Wells Fargo employee, are a current owner of a Wells Fargo consumer checking account or have already received a bonus for opening a Wells Fargo consumer checking account in the past 12 months. Monthly fees: $10 monthly unless you maintain a daily balance of at least $500, meet deposit requirements, have your account linked to a Wells Fargo Campus ATM card or a Campus Debit card or are 17-24 years old.

Promotion page: Wells Fargo Everyday Checking bonus

Wells Fargo Premier Checking Account: $2,500 Bonus

Wells Fargo is offering a $2,500 bonus for opening a Premier Checking account and meeting certain requirements.

Bonus value: $2,500

$2,500 Expiration date: April 16, 2025

How to claim: You must request a bonus offer code by entering your email address from the promotion page. You’ll then need to open a new Premier Checking account with an opening deposit of at least $25 at a Wells Fargo branch and provide the bonus offer code to the banker in person.

You must request a bonus offer code by entering your email address from the promotion page. You’ll then need to open a new Premier Checking account with an opening deposit of at least $25 at a Wells Fargo branch and provide the bonus offer code to the banker in person. Terms and conditions: You will need to bring $250,000 or more in new deposits to qualifying linked accounts within 45 days of opening the account and maintain that as a balance through day 90 after the account was upgraded or opened.

Promotion page: Wells Fargo Premier Checking bonus

Wells Fargo Savings Account: $525 Bonus

The Wells Fargo savings accounts, Way2Save and Platinum Savings, help grow your savings with features like overdraft protection and the option to make automatic monthly transfers into your savings account.

Bonus value: $525

$525 Minimum deposit to qualify: $25

$25 Expiration date: April 8, 2025

How to claim: Request a bonus offer code by entering your email address from the promotion page. Head to a Wells Fargo branch and open an eligible savings account with a minimum deposit of $25. Provide the banker with the bonus offer code when you open the account.

Request a bonus offer code by entering your email address from the promotion page. Head to a Wells Fargo branch and open an eligible savings account with a minimum deposit of $25. Provide the banker with the bonus offer code when you open the account. When you’ll get it: Within 30 days after meeting all the qualifying requirements

Within 30 days after meeting all the qualifying requirements Terms and conditions: You must deposit $25,000 in new funds to your savings account and maintain at least a $25,000 minimum daily balance for the first 90 days.

You must deposit $25,000 in new funds to your savings account and maintain at least a $25,000 minimum daily balance for the first 90 days. Monthly fees: For the Way2Save Savings account: $5 fee per statement cycle, which can be waived by keeping a daily minimum balance of $300 or if the account owner is under the age of 25 For the Platinum Savings account: $12, unless you maintain a daily minimum balance of $3,500



Earn more with the Wells Fargo Way2Save bonus.

How To Open a Wells Fargo Account

To take advantage of Wells Fargo promotions and bonuses, you need to open a new Wells Fargo checking account, savings account or credit card account. Fortunately, the bank makes opening a new credit card or deposit account easy and convenient. Here are a couple of ways to open an account:

Apply online for a credit card, checking account or savings account. Note that some promotions require opening an account at a branch.

Visit any Wells Fargo branch . You can use the online branch locator to find the one nearest to you.

How Does Wells Fargo Compare?

Wells Fargo has strong bank account offerings. How do they stack up against other banks? Here’s a glance at how Wells Fargo’s savings compares to similar banks.

Checking SELECTED BANK Wells Fargo Savings Account Start Banking MOST COMPARABLE Chase Savings Accounts Read Review MOST COMPARABLE Bank of America Savings Account Read Review Fees Fees Fees Up to $12 monthly service fee – can be waived $5 monthly, waivable $8 waivable monthly maintenance fee per statement cycle APY APY APY Up to for Platinum Savings accounts to for most accounts, 5% to 20% booster for Preferred Rewards members Min Opening Min Opening Min Opening $25 $0 $100

Final Take: Is Wells Fargo Right for You?

With the potential to earn cash back if you open a credit card or pad your checking account with a Wells Fargo sign-up bonus, it’s worth looking into becoming a Wells Fargo customer. Wells Fargo is an ideal bank for customers who want nationwide access to brick-and-mortar branches in addition to online and mobile banking options. Plus, it offers a full suite of banking products and services like savings accounts and CD accounts. All in all, Wells Fargo qualifies as a one-stop shop for banking needs.

Wells Fargo Bonus Offers and Promotions FAQ Here are the answers to some of the most frequently asked questions about Wells Fargo promotions. How long does it take to receive a new account bonus? Wells Fargo will apply the bonus within 30 days after meeting all of the qualifying requirements, such as maintaining the minimum balance on the account or setting up direct deposits.

Can existing customers qualify for these promotions? No. These bonuses are only available to new account openings at this time for new checking and savings. If you’ve received a Wells Fargo bonus in the last 12 months or are an existing customer, you won't qualify.

What happens if I close my account early? If you close your Wells Fargo checking or savings account early, you may not be eligible for the bonus. Some promotions require you to keep the account open for a certain amount of time, such as 90 days.

Are there any taxes on bank bonuses? Yes, the bank bonuses from Wells Fargo are reported to the IRS and thus may be considered interest income. You may be issued a 1099-INT form for any bonuses that amount to $10 or more.

Here are the answers to some of the most frequently asked questions about Wells Fargo promotions.

More About Wells Fargo

Sarah Sharkey, Melanie Grafil and Caitlyn Moorhead contributed to the reporting for this article.

Information on promotions is accurate as of March 12, 2025. Additional requirements may apply. Offers and terms are subject to change.

0.title: Overland Advantage and Wells Fargo Lead Senior Secured Credit Facilities to FFF Enterprises, Inc.
0.snippet: PRNewswire/ -- Overland Advantage ("Overland"), a business development company with a differentiated direct lending approach that benefits from a strategic.
0.content:
NEW YORK, Feb. 5, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Overland Advantage ("Overland"), a business development company with a differentiated direct lending approach that benefits from a strategic relationship between Centerbridge Partners and Wells Fargo, announced today that it served as sole lead arranger and book-runner for a $215.0 million credit facility in support of a new loan origination to facilitate the ongoing growth of FFF Enterprises, Inc. ("FFF"), a founder-owned company. In connection with the transaction, Wells Fargo continues to lead a $904.0 million Wells Fargo-agented asset-based loan.

FFF has been recognized as the nation's most trusted specialty drug distributor and diversified healthcare company since 1988.

"We are excited to partner with Overland, and we believe that the flexibility of the capital that was provided will enable FFF to focus on opportunities to expand our product offerings, grow our specialty distribution capabilities into new markets, and ultimately, support the overall healthcare ecosystem," said Patrick M. Schmidt, chief executive officer of FFF Enterprises.

"We are very pleased to support FFF," said Gavin Baiera, CEO and Trustee of Overland Advantage and Senior Managing Director at Centerbridge. "We have been a leading investor in healthcare businesses and providing an innovative financing solution through Overland highlights our capability and desire to support growing, founder-owned businesses."

Kurt Marsden, head of Wells Fargo Capital Finance, shared, "Providing long-time clients like FFF Enterprises with seamless access to private credit solutions through Overland and our leading asset-based lending platform gives them a broader set of options to pursue their goals, complementing our comprehensive suite of financial services including treasury management and investment banking."

About FFF Enterprises, Inc.

Founded in 1988, FFF Enterprises, Inc. is a privately held, multibillion-dollar specialty pharmaceutical distributor and diversified healthcare company. FFF Enterprises is the parent company to Nufactor, Inc., a specialty infusion company, InCircle, LLC, and RightNow Inventory.™ Our partners include global pharmaceutical and biologics manufacturers, prestigious healthcare systems, large and independent retail pharmacies, and leading alternate care sites. Our nationwide commerce is supported by a network of distribution and infusion pharmacy locations utilizing world-class technology and cybersecurity solutions.

For more information about FFF Enterprises, please visit its news site, LinkedIn, X, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube.

About Overland Advantage

Overland provides innovative lending solutions to founder, family and sponsor-owned middle market companies in North America and allows businesses to pursue their most important strategic goals.

Overland benefits from a strategic relationship between Centerbridge Partners and Wells Fargo, a leading commercial bank in the U.S. Overland borrowers can benefit from more seamless access to Wells Fargo's differentiated treasury management, investment banking services and senior bank capital and Centerbridge's leading private and alternative credit investment capabilities. Overland offers a unique, relationship-driven solution to meet the capital needs of privately owned middle market businesses, many of which have limited connectivity to private credit solutions.

Overland is managed by Overland Advisors Holdings, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, which is a controlled affiliate of Centerbridge and in which Wells Fargo has a significant, non-controlling minority equity investment.

For more information about Overland, visit www.overland-advantage.com.

About Centerbridge

Centerbridge Partners, L.P. is a private investment management firm employing a flexible approach across investment disciplines — Private Equity, Private Credit and Real Estate — in an effort to develop the most attractive opportunities for its investors. The firm was founded in 2005 and as of December 31, 2024, has approximately $40 billion in assets under management with offices in New York and London. Centerbridge is dedicated to partnering with world-class management teams across targeted industry sectors and geographies.

For more information, please visit www.centerbridge.com | LinkedIn .

About Wells Fargo

Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading financial services company that has approximately $1.9 trillion in assets. We provide a diversified set of banking, investment and mortgage products and services, as well as consumer and commercial finance, through our four reportable operating segments: Consumer Banking and Lending, Commercial Banking, Corporate and Investment Banking, and Wealth & Investment Management. Wells Fargo ranked No. 34 on Fortune's 2024 rankings of America's largest corporations. In the communities we serve, the company focuses its social impact on building a sustainable, inclusive future for all by supporting housing affordability, small business growth, financial health, and a low-carbon economy. News, insights, and perspectives from Wells Fargo are also available at Wells Fargo Stories.

Contacts

Kekst CNC

Jeremy Fielding / Anntal Silver / Daniel Hoadley

[email protected]

SOURCE Overland Advantage

1.title: Wells Fargo to close branch in downtown Albuquerque tower
1.snippet: Wells Fargo is planning to close the branch located inside the iconic, greenlit-at-night tower in downtown Albuquerque.
1.content:
The Wells Fargo sign on top of the big building that lights up in green at night is an iconic part of downtown Albuquerque but changes are coming to the branch there.

ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. — Wells Fargo is planning to close the branch located inside the iconic, greenlit-at-night tower in downtown Albuquerque.

A spokesperson for Wells Fargo confirmed the branch at 200 Lomas Blvd. NW will close May 7. After this, the company is inviting customers to use their branch at 3801 4th St. NW. That branch is around two miles away.

In November, a real estate developer told KOB 4 they had a contract to buy the Wells Fargo building. They plan to put apartments on several floors and a mix of offices and a restaurant on the first floor.

MORE:

2.title: How the Wells Fargo Autograph Stacks Up Against Competitors
2.snippet: How it compares to the Wells Fargo Autograph℠ Card: The flat rewards rate for most purchases makes the Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card a bit easier...
2.content:
Travel rewards credit cards pile on some sweet perks, but in many cases you’ll have to pay a hefty annual fee. That’s not the case with the Wells Fargo Autograph® Card, which offers a sign-up bonus and a high rewards rate in popular spending categories, all for a $0 annual fee.

Here’s what you’d get with this card.

NerdWallet rating NerdWallet's ratings are determined by our editorial team. The scoring formula incorporates coverage options, customer experience, customizability, cost and more. Learn More

Welcome offer and ongoing rewards

New cardholders will receive an enticing sign-up bonus: Earn 20,000 bonus points when you spend $1,000 in purchases in the first 3 months - that's a $200 cash redemption value.

You’ll earn 3 points per $1 spent in these categories:

Restaurants.

Travel.

Gas stations, transit, and electric vehicle charging stations.

Popular streaming services.

Select phone plans.

All other purchases earn 1 point per $1. You can redeem points for travel, gift cards, statement credits or when checking out online with PayPal.

Wells Fargo is also adding several airline and hotel transfer partners later in April 2024, offering another option for redeeming rewards.

Other benefits:

Cell phone protection against damage or theft. Get up to $600 when you pay your monthly cell phone bill with the Wells Fargo Autograph® Card. Note that there’s a $25 deductible.

Rental car coverage.

Travel and emergency services, including roadside dispatch.

Access to My Wells Fargo Deals, which offer discounts in the form of statement credits at participating merchants.

Autograph Card Exclusives: Get access to special concert/entertainment events.

The card has no foreign transaction fee, making it a good option for overseas travel. You can also get a reprieve from interest payments. Pay 0% intro APR on Purchases for 12 months from account opening, and then the ongoing APR of 19.24%, 24.24%, or 29.24% Variable APR.

Here’s how the Wells Fargo Autograph® Card compares to other no-annual-fee travel rewards cards.

Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card

NerdWallet rating NerdWallet's ratings are determined by our editorial team. The scoring formula incorporates coverage options, customer experience, customizability, cost and more. Learn More

Annual fee: $0.

Rewards:

Earn 1.5 points per $1 spent on all purchases.

Earn 3 points per $1 spent on travel booked through the Bank of America® Travel Rewards Center.

Redeem points in the form of a statement credit to pay for travel expenses or dining (including takeout).

Other benefits:

Bank of America Preferred Rewards® members earn 25% to 75% more points on each purchase.

Welcome bonus: 25,000 online bonus points after you make at least $1,000 in purchases in the first 90 days of account opening - that can be a $250 statement credit toward travel purchases.

APR: 0% Intro APR for 15 billing cycles for purchases, and for any balance transfers made in the first 60 days. After the Intro APR offer ends, a Variable APR that’s currently 18.24%-28.24% will apply.

Foreign transaction fee: None.

How it compares to the Wells Fargo Autograph® Card: The flat rewards rate for most purchases makes the Bank of America® Travel Rewards credit card a bit easier to manage, plus you’ll earn 50% more points on those “everything else” purchases that only earn 1 point per dollar with the Wells Fargo Autograph® Card. And the ability to redeem rewards for dining is a nice touch, since that can help you offset the cost of all those meals you buy during travel. (Preferred Rewards members, of course, get an even better deal.) But if you’re willing to manage a card with bonus rewards categories, the Wells Fargo Autograph® Card comes out on top in terms of overall value, given its higher rates in so many popular spending categories.

Discover it® Miles

NerdWallet rating NerdWallet's ratings are determined by our editorial team. The scoring formula incorporates coverage options, customer experience, customizability, cost and more. Learn More

Annual fee: $0.

Rewards:

Earn 1.5 miles per $1 spent on all purchases.

You can redeem miles in the following ways: for cash back in the form of a statement credit or direct deposit to your bank account, or for a statement credit to cover an eligible travel purchase. You can also pay with miles at select merchants such as Amazon and PayPal.

Welcome bonus: UNLIMITED BONUS: Unlimited Mile-for-Mile match for all new cardmembers—only from Discover. Discover gives you an unlimited match of all the Miles you’ve earned at the end of your first year. There’s no signing up, no minimum spending or maximum rewards. Just a Miles-for-Miles match. You could turn 35,000 Miles to 70,000 Miles.

APR: 0% intro APR for 15 months on purchases and balance transfers, and then the ongoing APR of 18.24%-27.24% Variable APR.

Foreign transaction fee: None.

How it compares to the Wells Fargo Autograph® Card: The Discover it® Miles is the simplest card of the bunch. You don’t even need to reach a spending minimum to get a sign-up bonus — whatever you spend in the first year will be doubled. And the ability to redeem miles for a statement credit or direct deposit makes this a hybrid travel/cash-back card. But, again, it doesn’t top the ability to earn 3 points per $1 on certain spending. Also note that Discover cards aren’t as widely accepted internationally compared with cards on the Visa and Mastercard networks.

Capital One VentureOne Rewards Credit Card - Miles Boost

Redeem miles for a statement credit as reimbursement for eligible travel purchases. Use miles to pay for travel booked through Capital One Travel, or redeem on Amazon or when using PayPal at checkout.

3.title: Meet Jeffrey Schub, Wells Fargo's New Sustainability Leader
3.snippet: After the departure of the firm's first Chief Sustainability Officer last year, Wells Fargo has appointed Jeffrey Schub as Head of Sustainability.
3.content:
Wells Fargo, one of the largest financial institutions in the United States, has a new sustainability leader.

Eight months ago the financial giant’s first Chief Sustainability Officer, Robyn Luhning, announced that she was stepping down from her role after 12 years at the company and two years as CSO.

Now, Jeffrey Schub has taken the lead –not as the company’s second CSO, but as Head of Sustainability.

Meet Jeffrey Schub

“Thrilled to share that I’m stepping into a new role at Wells Fargo as Head of Sustainability” Jeffrey shared in a LinkedIn post.

Jeffrey joined Wells Fargo in 2022 as SVP Sustainable Finance Integration Leader before being promoted to Interim Co-Head of Enterprise Sustainability at around the time Robyn departed.

4.title: Wells Fargo Cuts Varonis (VRNS)’s Target, Cites Slower ARR Growth
4.snippet: We recently published a list of Top 10 Trending AI News And Stock Ratings. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Varonis Systems,...
4.content:
We recently published a list of Top 10 Trending AI News And Stock Ratings. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Varonis Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRNS) stands against other top trending AI news and stock ratings.

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman continues to forge alliances in Asia, visiting India on February 5th to meet industry leaders and prominent founders and discuss the company’s plans for the Indian market.

Yesterday, Sam Altman was in South Korea to sign a deal with tech giant Kakao to integrate ChatGPT features into Kakao’s diverse services. OpenAI’s investments and partnerships, backed by the Stargate program, could indicate the US AI industry is racing to capture emerging markets amid the growing popularity of cheap and effective Chinese AI models like DeepSeek R1 and Alibaba’s Qwen 2.5. Altman reportedly admitted in South Korea that OpenAI “hasn’t found a strategy yet” to respond to DeepSeek.

“India is an incredible market for AI in general, for us too. It’s our second biggest market after the US. Users here have tripled in the last year. The innovation that’s happening, what people are building [in India], it’s really incredible,” Altman said. “We’re excited to do much, much more here, and I think it’s (the Indian AI program) a great plan. And India will build great models.”

Meanwhile, US stock futures retreated after Alphabet’s Q4 cloud revenue missed estimates and AMD’s disappointing data center sales forecast heightened concerns about a slump in AI momentum despite hefty R&D spending. Overall, investors remained alert for new developments in the ongoing US-China trade war.

We selected AI stocks by reviewing news articles, stock analysis, and press releases. We listed the stocks in ascending order of their hedge fund sentiment taken from Insider Monkey’s database of 900 hedge funds.

Why are we interested in the stocks that hedge funds pile into? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points (see more details here).

Varonis Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRNS)

Varonis Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRNS) is a supplier of cybersecurity solutions. Its software platform safeguards and automates unstructured data management using patented AI and ML technologies. The AI software features attributes like user behavior analytics and forensic analysis via interfaces like data advantage, data privilege, and the data classification engine for automated threat identification and remediation for enterprises.

5.title: Wells Fargo clears two mortgage-related consent orders from the Fed
5.snippet: The Federal Reserve has lifted two mortgage-related enforcement orders against Wells Fargo, the Fed said Tuesday.
5.content:
The bank has been working for years to address regulatory concerns stemming from multiple scandals. Just last week, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) terminated a separate 2022 order, which had required Wells Fargo to pay nearly $4 billion for widespread mismanagement in its auto lending, mortgage lending, and consumer deposit accounts.

Since 2019, Wells Fargo’s regulators have closed nine consent orders. However, the Federal Reserve’s $1.95 trillion asset cap, which has restricted the bank’s growth since 2018, remains. That enforcement action stems from Wells Fargo’s notorious fake accounts scandal, in which employees, under extreme sales pressure, created millions of unauthorized accounts between 2002 and 2016.

While the recent consent order terminations are a step forward, the Fed clarified that its 2018 enforcement action remains in effect. Wells Fargo cannot expand its assets beyond the cap until regulators are satisfied that systemic risk and governance issues have been fully addressed.

“The termination of these enforcement actions does not affect the board's 2018 enforcement action, which addressed widespread compliance issues by restricting Wells Fargo's growth, and remains effective,” the Fed said in a statement.

The end of the asset cap, however, may be on the horizon. In November, Reuters reported that Wells Fargo was in the “last stages of a process to pass regulatory tests,” citing unnamed sources who suggested the restriction could be lifted in the first half of 2025.

6.title: Major Healthcare Deal: Leading Drug Distributor FFF Enterprises Lands Massive $1.1B Financing Package
6.snippet: Leading specialty drug distributor FFF Enterprises receives $1.1B financing package to fuel market expansion and product growth, backed by Wells Fargo and...
6.content:
NEW YORK , Feb. 5, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Overland Advantage ("Overland"), a business development company with a differentiated direct lending approach that benefits from a strategic relationship between Centerbridge Partners and Wells Fargo, announced today that it served as sole lead arranger and book-runner for a $215.0 million credit facility in support of a new loan origination to facilitate the ongoing growth of FFF Enterprises, Inc. ("FFF"), a founder-owned company. In connection with the transaction, Wells Fargo continues to lead a $904.0 million Wells Fargo-agented asset-based loan.

FFF has been recognized as the nation's most trusted specialty drug distributor and diversified healthcare company since 1988.

"We are excited to partner with Overland, and we believe that the flexibility of the capital that was provided will enable FFF to focus on opportunities to expand our product offerings, grow our specialty distribution capabilities into new markets, and ultimately, support the overall healthcare ecosystem," said Patrick M. Schmidt, chief executive officer of FFF Enterprises.

"We are very pleased to support FFF," said Gavin Baiera, CEO and Trustee of Overland Advantage and Senior Managing Director at Centerbridge. "We have been a leading investor in healthcare businesses and providing an innovative financing solution through Overland highlights our capability and desire to support growing, founder-owned businesses."

Kurt Marsden, head of Wells Fargo Capital Finance, shared, "Providing long-time clients like FFF Enterprises with seamless access to private credit solutions through Overland and our leading asset-based lending platform gives them a broader set of options to pursue their goals, complementing our comprehensive suite of financial services including treasury management and investment banking."

About FFF Enterprises, Inc.

Founded in 1988, FFF Enterprises, Inc. is a privately held, multibillion-dollar specialty pharmaceutical distributor and diversified healthcare company. FFF Enterprises is the parent company to Nufactor, Inc., a specialty infusion company, InCircle, LLC, and RightNow Inventory.™ Our partners include global pharmaceutical and biologics manufacturers, prestigious healthcare systems, large and independent retail pharmacies, and leading alternate care sites. Our nationwide commerce is supported by a network of distribution and infusion pharmacy locations utilizing world-class technology and cybersecurity solutions.

For more information about FFF Enterprises, please visit its news site, LinkedIn, X, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube.

About Overland Advantage

Overland provides innovative lending solutions to founder, family and sponsor-owned middle market companies in North America and allows businesses to pursue their most important strategic goals.

Overland benefits from a strategic relationship between Centerbridge Partners and Wells Fargo, a leading commercial bank in the U.S. Overland borrowers can benefit from more seamless access to Wells Fargo's differentiated treasury management, investment banking services and senior bank capital and Centerbridge's leading private and alternative credit investment capabilities. Overland offers a unique, relationship-driven solution to meet the capital needs of privately owned middle market businesses, many of which have limited connectivity to private credit solutions.

Overland is managed by Overland Advisors Holdings, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, which is a controlled affiliate of Centerbridge and in which Wells Fargo has a significant, non-controlling minority equity investment.

For more information about Overland, visit www.overland-advantage.com.

About Centerbridge

Centerbridge Partners, L.P. is a private investment management firm employing a flexible approach across investment disciplines — Private Equity, Private Credit and Real Estate — in an effort to develop the most attractive opportunities for its investors. The firm was founded in 2005 and as of December 31, 2024, has approximately $40 billion in assets under management with offices in New York and London . Centerbridge is dedicated to partnering with world-class management teams across targeted industry sectors and geographies.

For more information, please visit www.centerbridge.com | LinkedIn .

About Wells Fargo

Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading financial services company that has approximately $1.9 trillion in assets. We provide a diversified set of banking, investment and mortgage products and services, as well as consumer and commercial finance, through our four reportable operating segments: Consumer Banking and Lending, Commercial Banking, Corporate and Investment Banking, and Wealth & Investment Management. Wells Fargo ranked No. 34 on Fortune's 2024 rankings of America's largest corporations. In the communities we serve, the company focuses its social impact on building a sustainable, inclusive future for all by supporting housing affordability, small business growth, financial health, and a low-carbon economy. News, insights, and perspectives from Wells Fargo are also available at Wells Fargo Stories.

Contacts

Kekst CNC

Jeremy Fielding / Anntal Silver / Daniel Hoadley

overland@kekstcnc.com

SOURCE Overland Advantage

Wells Fargo Active Cash Card Overview

The Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card is one of the best 2% cash rewards credit cards available, with unlimited earnings and no annual fee. The welcome bonus is easy to earn: $200 cash rewards bonus after spending $500 in purchases in the first three months from account opening. And rewards can be redeemed as cash or used for travel through Wells Fargo Autograph transfer partners, newly announced in 2024.

Wells Fargo Active Cash Card Rewards

Welcome Bonus

New cardholders can earn a $200 cash rewards bonus after spending $500 in purchases in the first three months from account opening. This is a competitive offer for a no-annual-fee credit card, and the minimum spending requirement is easily attainable for most people.

Earning Rewards

The Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card earns 2% cash rewards on purchases. It doesn't get any simpler than that, which is one of the biggest upsides of this card.

Redeeming Rewards

Rewards earned on the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card are part of the Wells Fargo Rewards program, which offers several redemption options.

Redeem to cover purchases charged to your card in amounts starting at $1

Redeem for statement credits to a Wells Fargo mortgage, loan, or credit product account

Redeem at a Wells Fargo ATM in increments of $20, although you'll need a Wells Fargo debit card to do so

Cash in your rewards for gift cards

Use your rewards to book travel, including airline tickets

Transfer points to airlines and hotels in the Wells Fargo Autograph transfer partners program

Maximizing Rewards with the Wells Fargo Active Cash

As of 2024, cardholders can convert cash rewards to travel miles and points through Wells Fargo transfer partners. Transferable credit card points are some of the best rewards to earn because they allow you to book luxury hotels or premium-class airfare for far less than their cash value. For example, travelers regularly book $5,000 or $10,000 flights for less than 100,000 points, or thousand-dollar hotel rooms for less than half that cost in points.

Expiration

Your cash rewards won't expire if your card is open and in good standing, where you pay your outstanding balance on time. If you're late with a payment, you won't be able to redeem rewards until your account is out of delinquency.

And, if you close your account, be sure to redeem your rewards before doing so. You'll forfeit any rewards in your account if you close it, unless you have another Wells Fargo Rewards card.

Wells Fargo Active Cash Card Key Benefits and Features

The Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card is a no-annual-fee card, so it comes with fewer benefits than most premium credit cards. But the card does offer a handful of beneficial features, including Visa Signature credit card benefits and perks.

0% Intro APR on Purchases and Balance Transfers

New cardholders are eligible for a 0% intro APR on purchases and qualifying balance transfers for 12 months from account opening, followed by a 19.24%, 24.24%, or 29.24% variable APR.

This isn't the longest intro APR Wells Fargo offers available, since the Wells Fargo Reflect® Card offers an even longer zero-interest period of 0% intro APR for 21 months from account opening on purchases and qualifying balance transfers made within 120 days, then 17.24%, 23.74%, or 28.99% Variable. But if you're looking to save on interest in the short term, it's a very good deal.

Cell Phone Insurance

If you pay your cellphone bill with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card, you're eligible for cell phone protection. This benefit is worth up to $600 per eligible claim of damage or theft, although a $25 deductible applies. You can make up to two claims per 12-month period.

Pro Tip: Most Wells Fargo credit cards offer complimentary cell phone protection with low deductibles.

24/7 Concierge Service

The Visa Signature® Concierge can help you make travel or dining plans or provide other types of personal assistance. This benefit is offered for free 24 hours a day.

Emergency Card Replacement

If your credit card is lost or stolen, this benefit can help you get a new card in hand within 24 hours.

Roadside Assistance and Dispatch

You can take advantage of complimentary roadside assistance when you hold the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card. This perk is free for you to use, but you'll need to pay out of pocket for whatever assistance comes your way.

This benefit includes a phone number you can call for pay-per-use assistance when you're on the road. For example, you can call roadside dispatch for help with a flat tire, tire changes, or lockout service. The service call is free, but you'll need to pay the locksmith or vehicle repair company when they arrive.

Travel and Emergency Assistance Services

This benefit is offered 24 hours a day in the form of an assistance hotline. You can use this hotline to get help with medical or legal referrals, emergency transportation assistance, emergency translation services, and more. As with roadside assistance, the phone service itself is complimentary, but you're responsible for any third-party costs.

Auto Rental Collision Damage Waiver

If you pay for a car rental with the Wells Fargo Active Cash card, this coverage will reimburse the cost of replacement or repairs if your rental vehicle is damaged or stolen for an eligible reason. This benefit can be very valuable, covering up to $50,000, but there are many exclusions and conditions for eligibility so be sure you carefully read the fine print in your Active Cash guide to collision benefits.

Rental Car Coverage Exclusions

In order for a claim to be eligible, your rental must meet all of the following requirements:

You must pay for the full cost of the rental card with your Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card and/or rewards program associated with the card account

You must decline the rental company's collision loss/damage insurance.

Your rental agreement cannot be longer than fifteen (15) consecutive days in the U.S., or thirty-one (31) consecutive days outside the U.S.

Coverage is excluded on rentals in Israel, Jamaica, the Republic of Ireland or Northern Ireland

Some countries or car rental agencies require a letter of coverage beforehand (call 1-800-316-8051 to get one, or visit the My Card Benefits page)

Maximum coverage amount is $50,000

Access to the Visa Signature Luxury Hotel Collection

Cardholders can book through the Visa Signature Hotel Collection, a credit card hotel booking program, and receive additional perks, including:

When you make a reservation through Visa Signature Hotels, you're automatically entitled to the following:

Room upgrade upon arrival, when available

Free in-room Wi-Fi

Late check-out upon request, when available

Complimentary breakfast for two

A $25 food or beverage credit

Fees

The Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card doesn't charge an annual fee. While no-annual-fee cards are common, it's rare to earn such a generous flat rate of return on purchases on a card that doesn't cost anything to keep in your wallet, especially since this card offers robust perks that can benefit any household.

Here are some other common costs and expenses to keep in mind:

No Annual Fee

This card has a $0 annual fee.

APR

0% intro APR: 0% intro APR on purchases and qualifying balance transfers for 12 months from account opening

Regular APR: 19.24%, 24.24%, or 29.24% variable APR

Foreign Transaction Fee

The Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card is a great credit card for domestic use, but it does charge a 3% foreign transaction fee on international purchases, so this is not the card to bring with you on when traveling abroad. This fee may even apply if you are within the U.S., but purchase something online from a company that's based in another country.

Additional Fees

As with many credit cards, you may incur charges for balance transfers, cash advances, and late payments.

Wells Fargo Active Cash Cardholder Reviews

To add additional context to our Wells Fargo Active Cash card review, we scoured popular forums like FlyerTalk and Reddit to see what cardholders have to say about it. Here are some of the most common opinions we found.

Easy Sign-Up Bonus (Welcome Offer)

Many cardholders said they chose the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card for its intro bonus of $200 cash rewards bonus after spending $500 in purchases in the first three months from account opening. The relatively slow spending requirement to earn the intro bonus makes it especially appealing.

Some Redemptions are Capped or Limited

Unlike some cash back credit cards, the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card only has automatic or paper cash rewards redemptions in increments of $25. For those who don't plan on using the card very frequently, it could take a while to redeem cash rewards. However, there is a workaround: You can use rewards to erase purchases from your statement.

Good for Flat-Rate Cash Rewards

Many cardholders said they like this card's ease of use, and turn to it when they make purchases that don't fall under another card's bonus categories. No matter what you buy, you know you're getting 2% back on your purchase.

Apply for the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card

Wells Fargo Active Cash Card Alternatives

Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card vs. Citi® Double Cash Card

The Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card's closest cash back competitor is the Citi® Double Cash Card. This popular card is very similar, yet also has some major differences.

The Citi® Double Cash Card also earns 2% cash back, but in a two-step process: you get 1 point per dollar (1% cash back) when you make a purchase and another 1 point per dollar (1% cash back) when you pay it off. This earning structure already puts the Citi® Double Cash Card at a slight disadvantage.

Where the Citi® Double Cash Card shines is in its long intro APR on balance transfers. New cardholders receive a 0% intro APR on balance transfers for 18 months, then a 18.24% - 28.24% Variable APR, making it one of the best balance transfer credit cards. However, this zero-interest period only applies to balance transfers.

The Citi® Double Cash Card doesn't offer cell phone protection and Visa Signature Concierge, which you'll get with the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card.

For a deeper dive into the differences between these cards, check out our Citi Double Cash card review.

Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card vs. Chase Freedom Unlimited®

If you don't mind juggling a few bonus categories, the Chase Freedom Unlimited® could be a good alternative to the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card.

The Chase Freedom Unlimited® is one of Business Insider's top picks for the best credit cards available right now. Amongst many other benefits, new cardholders can earn additional 1.5% cash back on everything you buy (on up to $20,000 spent in the first year).

Plus, you'll earn 5% cash back on travel booked through Chase Travel℠, 3% cash back on dining, 3% cash back at drugstores, and 1.5% cash back on everything else, with no limits. So if you spend a lot on travel, restaurants, and drugstores, you could earn more rewards with this card. It also offers a 0% intro APR on purchases and balance transfers for the first 15 months, then a 19.49% - 28.24% Variable APR.

Read more in our Chase Freedom Unlimited card review.

Best Cards to Pair with the Wells Fargo Active Cash Card

The Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card's top strength is its 2% cash rewards rate across the board, which makes it great to use for purchases that don't earn a bonus with other cards. The best strategy is to pair it with another that earns a high rate of rewards in categories where you spend the most.

For example, if you spend a lot on groceries, gas, and online shopping, you could pair the card with the Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express, which earns 3% cash back at U.S. supermarkets, at U.S. gas stations, and on U.S. online retail purchases (on up to $6,000 per category per year, then 1%), and 1% cash back on other purchases (cash back is received in the form of Reward Dollars that can be redeemed as a statement credit).

Wells Fargo Active Cash Card Frequently Asked Questions

Is the Wells Fargo Active Cash card a good credit card? Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options. The Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card is a good credit card if you want to earn 2% cash rewards on purchases without paying an annual fee. While the card isn't jam-packed with benefits, it comes with a few handy perks that can save you money, such as cell phone insurance. What is the Wells Fargo Active Cash Card? Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options. Is the Wells Fargo Active Cash made of metal? Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options. No, the Wells Fargo Active Cash® Card isn't a metal card. It's made of plastic, like most other cards.
