8.title: It will soon be New Year's Day; here's what will be open and closed across Delaware
8.snippet: New Year's Day falls is Wednesday, and banks, courts and most services will be closed or curtailed in Delaware January 1.
8.content:
It will soon be New Year's Day; here's what will be open and closed across Delaware

Show Caption Hide Caption Museum hold New Year's Eve countdown for kids The Delaware Children's Museum held two New Year's Eve countdowns for kids Monday afternoon to ring in 2019. 12/31/18 Damian Giletto, The News Journal

The countdown to New Year's Day is on, and to properly navigate the first federal holiday of 2025, you will need to know what will be open and closed across Delaware on Jan. 1.

New Year's Day falls on a Wednesday, so many businesses and functions will be impacted by the midweek holiday.

Major banks in Delaware will be closed on New Year's Day

The major banks — Bank of America, Capital One, Citibank, PNC, Wells Fargo and Truist — consider New Year's Day to be a bank holiday, and will all be closed.

Santa Claus greets Delawareans at Wilmington Jaycees Christmas Parade Santa Claus brings up the rear at the Wilmington Jaycees Christmas Parade on Nov. 30, 2024.

Will federal courts be open on New Year's Day?

New Year's Day is a federal holiday, and as such, all federal and Delaware state courts and non-essential services will be closed on Jan. 1, 2025.

However, Delaware's 24-hour Justice of the Peace courts aren't subjected to state closings or holidays, and may be operating on New Year's Day.

Mail, packages won't be delivered on New Year's Day

FedEx will be closed on New Year's Day, and will not deliver any packages.

All United States Postal Service locations will be closed on New Year’s Day. Regular post office hours and mail delivery will resume on the Thursday, January 2.

UPS will be closed on New Year's Day as well, and will not deliver any packages.

Can I buy liquor in Delaware on New Year's Day?

If you need to hoist an impromptu toast on New Year's Day in Delaware, you'll have options.

According to both the Delaware Code and the Delaware Alcoholic Beverage Control Commissioner, liquor sales are only prohibited on Easter, Thanksgiving and Christmas and Easter.

Damon C. Williams is a Philadelphia-based journalist reporting on trending topics across the Mid-Atlantic Region.

9.title: Top 10 financial services stories of 2024
9.snippet: In this round-up of 2024, we feature how US bank Wells Fargo, which holds $1.9tn in assets, is using business automation software and artificial intelligence.
9.content:
It seems fintech has been replaced by generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) as the most-used term in banking IT this year.

Fintech, after all, is not a technology but a movement, which will undoubtedly see its next evolution through the use of AI, with GenAI the chosen conversation-starter for most.

Research from Accenture last year said GenAI would be central to enterprise over the next decade, and as a leader, the finance sector is on that journey.

For example, in this round-up of 2024, we feature how US bank Wells Fargo, which holds $1.9tn in assets, is using business automation software and artificial intelligence to help people manage the estates of relatives following a bereavement.

Meanwhile, as businesses increasingly use AI, reinsurance giant Munich Re expects more demand for AI insurance from organisations that are looking to manage the risks of AI. Re is trying to arm the industry with the good-old safety net of insurance.

A few years ago, the use cases made public for AI were few and far between, but this has changed rapidly as the understanding of the technology has improved among enterprises, with widespread use of different forms of AI.

In contrast, a technology that still leaves people scratching their heads is quantum computing. The technology promises to transform humanity, but try explaining how to the person on the street, or even in business.

The technology is theoretical at the moment, but banking industry trade association UK Finance has warned banks to get up to speed.

It may appear old hat these days with quantum computing and GenAI stealing the headlines, but banks still have lots to do to fully harness these technologies’ advantages. Read in this list how UK finance firms Admiral Insurance and Nationwide Building Society are doing just.

Here are Computer Weekly’s top 10 financial services stories of 2024.

3. Financiers isolate Middle East over sanctions-evading paytech Financiers have pulled support for a paytech system being rolled out in the Middle East after it became embroiled in Russian plans to evade sanctions.

4. Lords to challenge controversial DWP benefits bank account surveillance powers Members of the House of Lords are pressing for amendments to the Data Protection and Digital Information Bill following concerns over government powers to monitor the bank accounts of people receiving benefits.

5. Silicon Valley Bank collapse explained: What you need to know Not all banks cater to startup companies. Silicon Valley Bank specialised in the tech startup industry, but was not prepared for a bank run as companies started burning more cash.

6. Munich Re sees strong growth in AI insurance Global reinsurance giant Munich Re expects more demand for AI insurance from organisations that are looking to manage the risks of AI as they experiment more with the technology.

7. Insurance company Admiral partners with Google Cloud for digital transformation push Insurance company Admiral has made Google its strategic cloud partner, as it embarks on a push to boost the efficiency of its operations and improve the experience it offers to customers.

9. CTO interview: Budgeting in nanoseconds Andrew Phillips has worked at financial technology company LMAX Group for 17 years, and is currently the company’s chief technology officer. His budget is measured in nanoseconds.
